Short walk to the beach and rec trail that can be walked to SC pier. Many restaurants, stores, shops, SC pier all within 1.5 miles of SC Inn.

Summary Heading: A place to stay in San Clemente
Summary: 1st off the Manager Lisa did a excellent job giving information at the 1:00 pm check about Covid 19 and the safety protocols that they take! This is a family place to stay near the beach it‚Äôs walking distance Down a long street hill about 15 minutes and back up long hill. It‚Äôs diffidently a budget place with budget minded travelers. We booked a week and only stayed 2 nights my children‚Äôs unfortunately didn‚Äôt feel safe being there at all and the pool was filled with guest that seemed sketchy and I didn‚Äôt want to go near the pool Myself. My children also didn‚Äôt feel safe sleeping there they wondered how I found this place. The staff is very nice and the rooms I think are updated and can fit families nicely. But budget for sure! But I paid a lot to stay there..... I was thinking it

They told me I had to wait in the lobby and they would call names according to a list and I had to be present to get my room early. The lobby proceeded to fill up with vacationers there for timeshares. Hardly anyone wore masks, except a few elderly and myself, and NONE of the staff wore masks, even though they were all talking closely with customers. Then the manager proceeded to address the crowded room, with no mask, with a speech about how "Covid isn't really a thing in Orange County... they're just not worried about it here." She even joked about how Gov. Newsom almost shut down

Summary Heading: Horrible cheap bed and no one was wearing a mask
Summary: We checked in for a couples get away during the pandemic. No one working there was wearing a mask! Toilet seat was broken but they sent a maintenance guy to fix it right away he was not wearing a mask or gloves and working on toilet and going in and out touching the door knobs. We booked for 3 nights but only stayed 1. The bed was so hard and uncomfortable we left after one day.

I just needed to use some points before they expired and this was close for all family members.  The beach was fantastic, the place was clean, it wasn't hemmed in with development all around, the pool was warm...even for me, work out gym was great, and plenty of games for families that I enjoyed.

Going back to stay at the San Clemente Inn soon. My family had a great time. The hotel is awesome. Great location!! The gym is nice and the game room has lots of things to do. The Murphy beds were cool!

Summary Heading: No hot water one one, no water at all the second day
Summary: I can't believe this place. Our first day we didn't have any hot water...our second day we didn't have any water at all. Their response? "Oh, we thought people would be done showering by now". We're on vacation! What does it matter? We expect water in our hotel!
Manager Response: David,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We are sorry to hear you did not enjoy your recent visit. Unfortunately, we did have a unforeseen event involving a water heater in one of our buildings that had failed. Management worked as quickly as possible in getting this resolved. We did offer each of our clients for the temporary water shut off during the water heater replacement to either move rooms or use a vacant room to shower and get ready in. Although we know that this may have inconvenience our client's day, unfortunately, no preventive maintenance could have provided warning that the water heater could fail. In these situations, the most management can do is try and repair the maintenance issue as quickly as possible and provide our client's with alternatives.  Again we are sorry to hear you did not enjoy your stay and for the inconveniences you incurred. Please feel free to contact management 7 days a week anytime between 9am and 5:30pm to discuss this further. Thank you.

Summary: This place was terrible! No privacy--our "view" looked straight into other units, and they into ours; kept curtains closed most of the time. No hot water for 2 days in a row, and no water at all for 1. Mgmt gave us ZERO notice of these events. When we complained, they said, "everyone should have taken their showers already." Inconsiderate. Very rundown. Ruined vacation.
Manager Response: Dear Cynthia,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your recent visit. Although you felt management did not provide you with solutions to your issues, we certainly did our best to try and address all of your concerns. During your stay you asked for a room that did not look onto our back building, which we did provide you with an option to move to a back building overlooking our greenbelt. This option to move was declined. Because Management knew you were not happy with your accommodations, we tried to partner with you and the exchange company (RCI) that you traded into the property with to assist you in potentially being located to another property. However, without your participation during this process we were unable to assist you further with this. Unfortunately, RCI requires the guest also be in communication during potential relocation's, which you stated you did not have the time to wait on the phone for this process. In regards to the water this was an unforeseen event that the Resort worked to repair as quickly as possible. Without warning one buildings water heater failed. This required a plumber be called and the water heater be replaced. Yes, this did require the Resort turn water off a couple times over a two day period to replace the water heater in that building, which staff called to notify each client. The water each day was turned off no more than two hours the first day and three hours the next day when the tank was replaced. Although we know this was an unfortunate inconvenience to our clients, as I am sure you can imagine, without turning the water off there is no way to replace the water heater and fix the problem. Our staff did contact everyone in that building when we were able to identify the issue and offered each guest to relocate to another room in a different building or offered them to minimally shower in another room, so each guest did not have to move all of their belongings. Many of our other clients took advantage of this offer, but your party declined.  Again, we thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We are very sorry it was not up to the standards you expected. We hope we have an opportunity to serve you and your family again in the future. If you would like to discuss your stay further with management, a manager is on duty 7 days a week 9am to 5:30pm. Thank you.

Summary: We stayed here for a few nights in October 2019 for a family reunion. Although we booked a junior suite, the room was much larger than expected, more of the size of a small apartment. The kitchenette is well-stocked with supplies, and the fridge is a full apartment-sized fridge. The murphy beds in the dining area were a great addition, as we ended up needing a bed for a third family member (and she told us it was really comfortable to sleep on!). It was very convenient and budget-happy for our situation, and we will likely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great room With A Gorgeous View
Summary: I loved the hotel, I checked in at 4pm sharp with no problem. The room was squeaky clean and it came fully equipped with kitchen utensils/cups/plates. We had a beautiful view of the ocean. Anthony at the front desk was exceptionally polite and their movie check out program is a great feature if you happen to get bored.  However, we didn't even get the chance to enjoy the hotel's mini golf or numerous activities.

Summary Heading: Resort near State Park and ocean
Summary: Newly remodeled lobby is very beautiful, and they were very helpful directing us where we wanted to go!  Bedding was nice & clean!  We needed to get blood work done for my husband, & they printed out directions to that office!  We plan on going back!

This is a pleasant resort with a TON of things to do. The beach is close. There many things to do on the site. The staff is pleasant. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The price is great for the location and what you get.   On the down side, the whole place could use an update and the internet is SLOW.   This is a great place if you're looking for a home base for both San Diego and Orange county. Would be great for kids.

The unit needed a little upgrading and the internet needs work.  Staff super.  A pleasure to stay here once again for it is in the same town as my daughter‚Äôs city..  the ex manager made all problems disappear

I live in Long  beach, ca., and this was a short 1 hour drive from my home, but a real resort with amenities, even though there was construction.  It created no problems, and the resort staff are very helpful and professioa.

The resort offered plenty of on site amenities, I enjoyed the 10-15 minute walk to the Sate Beach as well as the 35 minute walk to the San Clement pier.  I also walked through the cute town of San Clemente and enjoyed the Outlets too.  Used the kitchen regularly, checked out movies, enjoyed the Jacuzzi too.

This establishment is very clean and festive. They have a knowledgeable staff that makes you feel at ease. They give you the information you need and directions to local stores and entertainment. It is conveniently located with a private feel.

San Clemente is an older resort, and they have made some remodeling to the main part of the resort.  The units could use some upgrading too. Staff very friendly. We had a good breakfast at the resort, though a little pricey, but it is CA.

Summary Heading: Nice resort, but aggressive bouncer at on-site comedy club
Summary: Resort is easy to get to/from becasue it's so close to the freeway, so you can hear the highway from the rooms facing the freeway; Nice hot tub and pool; lots to do within 20min of the resort; car is highly recommended. Breakfast at Adele's, the restaurant on site was very good.  However - the night we arrived, my husband went to see if Adele's still served dinner - unbeknownst to him, they were in the middle of a comedy club event. An aggressive bouncer? literally grabbed my husband to move him away from a camera instead of simply asking him to move over.  NOT COOL!  My husband left to avoid an altercation/scene and I complained to the Inn's staff who assured me that they would discuss with Adele's management.

Beautiful grounds, easy, friendly, helpful check in, fitness center very small but very close to a sea side walk. We have a great view of the horizon sunsets from our balcony in the back building. Would definitely come back.

Staff is wonderful. If you are lucky enough to meet Avy and Susan, you are lucky. Many activities that are fun. I am not usually a participant, but Avy Is a real asset, and worth going checking out what she has planned. The resort is in the middle of an update. The pool and game areas are very nice, and lots to do.

We enjoyed our room. Loys of space, ocean view, easy access to freeway, town, shopping and other fun places.  Dana Point Harbor Parade of Lights was great. Oldrer timeshare so room was a bit dated and could use some upgrades to window and sliding glass door, but overall a very nice place for a weeks stay.

My sisters and I enjoyed staying at this timeshare. It‚Äôs conveniently located right off of Interstate 5 near San Clemente State Park.  The lobby is decorated beautifully for the holidays. The on-site restaurant boasts the best breakfast in town in local publications. They offer $4 mimosas Mon-Fri AM. It was cool and rainy during our stay so we were unable to enjoy the outdoor amenities. However, the pool looked very inviting  as do the outdoor activities (mini golf, shuffleboard, etc.). The rooms are very comfortable for 3 people (it might be a little tight for 4). The kitchen is stocked well for light cooking. The full sized refrigerator works well for leftovers, takeout and beverages.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Needs work, but they are in the process of up-dates
Summary: The staff is excellent, the gardens are spectacular!  The furniture in the rooms need up-grading.  Our TV had to be worked on and the dishwasher had to be worked on.  Again, the staff was very helpful and responsive.  We enjoyed breakfast at Adeles where the staff was excellent.

Rooms on 3rd floor have great view of ocean and sunsets from balconies. Excellent room cleanup on daily basis. Near to beach access and downtown San Clemente attractions. Nice municipal golf course is across highway.

We were happy with everything. From the front desk. The lobby was amazing. Housekeeping, Adelles. The convenience of getting around. I don't know what else to say.  The mattress was a little hard. I had trouble sleeping. But we will come back.

This is our second RCI exchange at the Inn and they‚Äôve made lots of upgrades. There is lots to do for families. Wouldn‚Äôt want to stay in front units, as they have no view, other than the parking lot and back units. The 3rd floor of the back units however are quiet with sea views. Summary Heading: Late November trip 2019 - San Clemente Inn
Summary: A very pleasant surprise.  Adele Restaurant is a hidden gem.  Great breakfast.  The place was built to facilitate Richard Nixon's secret service folks when he lived around San Clemente.  It has that mysterious charm.

The outside of the facility where the pool is in back of the resort is
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you are no enjoying your stay and feel the rooms are dated. In truth, those rooms were remodeled in 2016. If you would like we can contact RCI to share your experience with them regarding your week. Although RCI will require you contact them first, we would be happy to speak with them as well to let them know that you were not satisfied with your stay. Thank you so much for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Great staff but renovations in progress
Summary: This wonderful location (w/in walking distance of a state park and the beach) and excellent staff will get 4 stars from us once the renovations are complete. We chose it as it's 45 minutes from both Disneyland & San Diego which we visited during the week. The pool & two spas (one for children and one for adults) and recreation room (books, board games and small gym area) werevery  nice and the bingo night (with prizes!) was fun. There was active construction during our stay (which we knew ahead of time) but the construction debris was not picked up in a timely manner so one had to be careful walking around. The room we were in clearly hadn't been updated yet, although it was clean. The sheets & towels were plentiful and the bed & pillows were comfortable but the decor, carpet

The staff was absolutely fantastic.  The swimming pool seemed like it was one of the pools that uses salt rather than chlorine, which my children loved.  They also had a fun mini golf course that we enjoyed.  We walked about 3-4 blocks down to the San Clemente beach from the San Clemente Inn.  We also visited Disneyland and San Diego.  The drive to both places was about 45 minutes from the San Clemente Inn, and we did not encounter any traffic.  Dana Point whale and dolphin tours were about a 15 minute drive.  San Clemente Inn is definitely top on our list for a place to stay when we come to

Summary: Although this destination is not too far from where we live, we needed a break, close enough to drive to work each day. Wow, what a great week,   A short walk to the State Park, and beach. And only a short walk along a safe and nice trial to the San Clemente Pier, 1.83 miles each way.  We had beautiful weather,great sunsets from our balcony window, room 217.   The staff was amazing and the pool and game room is fun.   Plenty of great eats at the pier and close by. You can drive, Uber or just walk, Very safe area.

Summary Heading: Had a Great Stay at San Clemente Inn!
Summary: I am very much enjoying my three-night stay at the San Clemente Inn ‚Äì don‚Äôt let the aging exterior of the place discourage you, as the rooms are modern and offer so many welcome amenities. Summary: This rustic  in comes with And impressive amount of necessities. Refrigerator, dishes and microwave  makes this the perfect getaway if you are tired of camping in the San Clemente Beach Campground.  Easily located right off the freeway with great amenities such as a tennis court,  pool and Jacuzzi.  Currently they are having some renovations done, but if the inside of the lobby is any indication of the direction that this quaint spot is headed your in for a treat

The room looked like a combination between outdated and modern with really outdated ceilings but modern decor.  It‚Äôs a great location to hit up the beaches and restaurants in San Clemente although next time I will try to find somewhere right on the beach.  I like how they have DVD rentals available with a great selection. The only downside is the TV in our room wasn‚Äôt great and the speakers were not clear.

Summary Heading: Great place for family and solo alike.
Summary: Excellent location off the highway.  A short drive down the street to the beach.  Very roomy and clean premises.  Staff was very welcoming and smoking only permitted in certain areas so fantastic for the nonsmokers.  Beds are wonderful and cozy. Would definitely recommend.

Summary Heading: Good location in a cute area
Summary: Good location for Catalina Island day trip. We used Catalina Express and it left from Dana Point less than 10 minutes away.  Only a block away from the state beach with a cute snack bar. Don't expect a room with a view though.

Summary Heading: Great fAmily  hotel close to the beach.
Summary: Perfect hotel for our family reunion this summer.  Kitchen was a bonus.  So roomy.  Miniature golf and the game room kept kids occupied while adults sat at the pool.  So close to the beach....walking down was f8e, but needed someone in a car to bring us back.

The Junior Suites are perfect for the family with master bedroom, 2 bathrooms, Murphy beds, sleeper couch, kitchenette, breakfast table, tv, patio, and family sitting area.  The property has swimming pool, hot tub, mini-golf, BBQ areas, work out gym and more!

This hotel is both the cats pajamas AND the bees knees. It's so cute and lovely! The decor is  an awesome beach theme that makes you feel at home. And the staff goes above and beyond! Especially Jill G.! What a peach! We loved it so much we ended up extending our stay! It's small enough to feel personal but also sizable amenities.  We really enjoyed our stay and recommend for others! Ask for the Cant Remember at Adeles restaurant!#SanClementeInIsWhereItsAt

Great location. San Clemente park was right there and the pier was a short distance away.  There are many restaurants very nearby.  The lobby was very nice but the rooms were really outdated.  The sheets were very worn and the carpeting was dirty.  It was nice to have a bath and a half but the sinks had a very bad sewer smell.  Maintenance did come and work on them but the fix only lasted about one day.

San Clemente Inn is a great place to stay for a weekend getaway or a week vacation! The room has everything you need, plenty of activities and walking distance to the beach.  Great place to relax and have a good time.  The customer service is superb and always available to make sure you have everything you need and having fun.  San Clemente Inn is my teenage son's #1 place to go!

Great amenities.  Great view.  Great staff.  Well most certainly stay again.  Worth sharing with friends and family.  The beach is close and parking is no issue.  Great restaurants are within walking distance. Maybe not; want it all to myself.

We‚Äôre having a wonderful time here. Our room is great. The kitchen has everything we need. We love using the BBQ‚Äôs. They always have fun activities and everyone on the staff is so friendly. We will definitely be back.

We stayed a week and wish it was longer. The area is ideal for relaxing and winding down from the stress of work. Lot's of activities available during our stay. Only wish they would rent chairs and umbrellas for the local beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! Hope to see you again soon:)

Summary Heading: Ideal location for whale watching and beach

The staff always makes it feel like home and are responsive to any concern. I exchanged to go there a few times. I liked it to the extent that I bought a unit. They have added a couple activities, one that includes wine, that added to the enjoyable stay.

We love San Clemente Inn. There is always so much going on that the whole family can participate in. The staff is always friendly, and always willing to help any way they can. They all want to make sure that you have the best experience possible,  wheather it's your first time there, or you've been coming for years!!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary Heading: Great location, clean, quiet and comfortable
Summary: Stayed in a one bedroom with a limited kitchen.  There are also two murphy beds that pull out from the wall in the area adjacent to the dining room and living room, so the unit can sleep four.  There is a dishwasher, fridge, stovetop and small appliances plus the usual dishes, etc.  Not really enough counter space to prepare meals though.  There is a pool, mini golf and tennis court on the premises, as well as a restaurant (Adele's) in the reception area.  Good food and on the weekends there is entertainment.  The location is also within walking distance of the San Clemente Beach, which has a snack shack there. Summary: This is a great place to stay with a family! Convenient to beach & town. The activities were perfect for kids under 10, loved the rec room & outdoor games. The mini golf could use some updating but it was fine. I wish there were food option for the pool area for the afternoon. Beds are comfortable, kitchen was great! Water pressure in the shower was awesome! Super friendly! Love staying here! I love that every time I come here there are improvements! I hope that continues.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your stay. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: San Clemente Inn offer adult and children activities daily. They have many amenities for their guest such as Miniature Golf and Shuffle Board. Great pool two spas. Recreation Room and gym. Close to the beach. It‚Äôs a wonderful experience for any Family!! Gary Marca

Summary: The rooms are dated. The carpets need to be changed. The staff were friendly. The lobby/ game room were great. We arrived at 2pm. One unit was ready, the other was not ready until after 5:30pm. Loved the area but will not stay at the resort again.

Summary: San Clemente Inn is a great place to vacation with your family! It is a hidden treasure and walking distance to the beach. The staff there are Amazing Incredible People. Our kids always look forward to vacationing  at San Clemente Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: Last minute reservation and were taken care of. Staff is friendly and professional. Can‚Äôt beat the distance from the beach either. Definitely recommend. Family friendly as well with events and amenities to keep busy and rest
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your stay. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: Booked a last minute trip 20 minutes before arriving. The guy at the front desk was nice and got us a room right away! There‚Äôs plenty of amenities with things do in the hotel as well as being right near the beach.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: I‚Äôm staying at the timeshare here, and have been impressed by most things, and disappointed by a couple of things. Drawbacks are the pool is small, no salt and pepper in the units, and the outdoor grills require charcoal instead of having propane. I mention these things so you can come prepared. Also, it has no elevators to the rooms which are 3 story. This is why I rated it 4 out of 5.

Summary: It is good to stay in San Clemente Inn. Nearly by beach, going shopping in outlets, it is a beautiful town for sightseeing. We enjoy playing mini golf in the garden, swimming, there are two hot tubs, we love this place.

Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. We are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay, but appreciate your feedback. We do have a pre-registration process on Sundays that differs from all other days of the week. It is done based on the order of when a reservation was booked, however, no guest is required to participate in this process. Our guest have the option of arriving at our check in time (4pm) at which time they are guaranteed a room to check into immediately. If you do choose to take part in our early pre-registration process, no one is required to be there before 1pm when our registration begins. The Lobby has four 70'' televisions in it for our guest's viewing and one 50'' television downstairs in our Recreation Room, which is available to all guests. We do have multiple vending machines onsite and a restaurant (Adele's) on property that is open 7 days a week. Lastly our Lobby and Recreation Room have upwards of 40 outlets located in the building. We hope that you will contact Management directly at the Resort by calling 949-492-6103 as we would like to discuss your concerns further with you. Please note, there is no individual owner of the San Clemente Inn as you stated you tried to contact. The San Clemente Inn is comprised of 4800 individual homeowners who elect a five member Board of Directors to make decisions in the best interest of the Resort. If you would like to contact our Board you are welcome to write a letter and send it to the San Clemente Inn. Our Board meets next in November at which time your letter would be reviewed and you would receive a response.  Thank you.

Big kudos to whomever returned my items you are to be commended! Many thanks again, Kristen Adamson Rm# 151  checked in on June 4th, checked out June 5th.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with the San Clemente Inn. The resort strives to provide our guests with the best possible customer service and experience that we can. We hope to serve you again during your future travels.

Summary: We had to have maintenance to our room for 4 separate issues so that was not great but they did respond quickly.  lots to do and see within minutes of the resort and Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm San Diego all no to far from this resort.  San Clemente is a great little coastal town. We loved the shops and restaurants here so that made up for a less than wonderful lodging experience. We were not in the room too much so that was good. Resort has a small collection of Dvds to rent out for free as well as shuffle board and a small mini gold course. There is a decent restaurant on site as well.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with the San Clemente Inn. The resort strives to provide our guests with the best possible customer service and experience that we can. We hope to serve you again during your future travels.

Summary: The San Clemente Inn has all of the amenities that I look for in a hotel: full kitchen (refrigerator, microwave, stove top, dishes, blender, toaster, etc.) separate sitting area, comfortable bed. And the location (close to old downtown San Clemente) was the best! We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your stay. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: The room was perfect for a family of 4. Two pull out beds for the kids was a plus. A kitchen with a table and some couches makes it seem like a little condo by the beach. There is a tv in the common area and a little one in the bedroom so we didn't have to watch cartoons with the kids. Overall we enjoyed it and the Staff was friendly. The only thing I would have to critique about is he rooms were outdated and it could have been a bit cleaner.
Manager Response: Glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at the San Clemente Inn. We hope to see you again soon

Summary: I'm not a big Groupon user, but I found a Groupon for this hotel.   I was very happy with my room and the hotel.  We had the 1 bedroom suite.  I found the accommodations perfect and roomy.  We didn't use the amenities but I would give this a 5-star review based upon the price, location and condition of our room.  Highly recommend.  Slight note.  At this time, the reception is in a trailer while they renovate the reception area.  This was not an impediment for checkin or services.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your stay. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: The hotel was in a great location to the stores, Main Street, freeway access, and beaches. The room had plenty of space and was very comfortable. The full size refrigerator made it very nice to be able to keep snacks and breakfast foods. It was completely stocked with dishes, dishwasher, and small stove. There was also a nice size balcony to enjoy the sunsets. The property was very well maintained with a pool, jacuzzi, miniature golf, basketball court, and barbecues. We will be back when staying in southern Orange County!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: I stayed a week at this resort in a single suite. Accommodations were more than adequate for a single person. Activities on site are shuffleboard, miniature golf,  ping pong, swimming pool and jacuzzi,  barbecue areas, and gazebos for just relaxing.  I did not use the fitness room.  There are many shops nearby, the pier, and Mission San Juan Capistrano.  Also a movies theater.  The office holds a decent library OS dvd's that can be checked out.   This is definitely a place I will return to.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. I am happy to hear that our rooms met your needs during your stay. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: We are currently staying for a week in a breaker unit. The unit is clean and well stocked and is serviced each day if required and dishwasher detergent, toilet tissue, soap etc topped up as required which isn't always the case In a timeshare unit. The Lounge is a good size and although the bedroom is small it's perfectly adequate. There is plenty of drawer and hanging space available. The pool and whirlpools are clean and well maintained as are the grounds in general.  There is Maintenance taking place at present to the lobby, games room and front gardens but didn't cause too much inconvenience in respect of noise unlike some of the other inconsiderate guests who seem to think their noise cannot be heard by others, whether they are partying or dragging furniture around in the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review regarding your recent stay with us.  We hope you can visit us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Amazing stay even though under construction
Summary: Resort was under construction (lobby/rec room and landscape) during our stay. Clean spacious units/friendly staff and incredible grounds. Kids enjoyed all the free activities,wifi and DVD library. No extra charges for anything or parking. Cant wait to return and see the million dollar renovations! Tip: beach parking in San Clemente is metered.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the San Clemente Inn. We are thrilled to hear our hotel provided your family with a great stay. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: This property has very poor customer service, including Lisa the manager. They damaged my car and refused to take responsibility for it. I would not stay at this run down place again. Lightning on property is unsafe. Beware!
Manager Response: Dear David C,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the San Clemente Inn. In response to your claim regarding the water spots left on your car due to onsite landscape sprinklers, as you are aware Management opened a claim with our insurance company which you have been in contact with. If you have any additional information that you believe would affect your claim for damages, please contact your assigned insurance adjuster. If you for any reason do not have the claim number or contact information for your assigned adjuster, please feel free to contact the Management team at San Clemente Inn by calling 949-492-6103.

Summary: We stayed here with kids for 2 days while hitting amusement parks nearby (Legoland and Knott's Berry Farm), and it's about in the middle. Location was great, right off freeway, but quiet.   We pack light and plan to wash laundry every day or two once kids are in pajamas, but they close the laundry room from 9 pm to 9 am. After explaining the situation to the front desk, who acted like we were causing a major problem, they did allow us to wash laundry after hours. Frank, the person who normally locks up the room was very kind and accommodating. (We finished laundry both nights before 10, which is when the pool closes.) Washing and drying are each $1 and the machines work really well-- none of my loads took the full 60 minutes of dry time given.  Outside of the funky laundry room
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the San Clemente Inn.  We appreciate the feedback. Please come visit us soon.

Summary: The reason for my answer is because the hotel was under construction when we got there. The home page when we book our trip did not say that there was going to be things down like there game room,loby ect. I will say the staff was friendly and helpful. There was still lots to do there our room had a lovely view looking out to all the trees. The house keeping need to improved the second day we ask to clean our room when we where out they only swept the floors and forgot to give us new towels.  Over all we will be visting again once everything is done.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. We hope to see you again once the renovation is completed.

Summary: I found a deal for a 90 dollar room for a night on groupon, decided to try it out with the lady friend for a weekend and it was well worth the trip, as well as the stay. Would totally come back and stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review! We look forward to seeing you here again!

Summary: Room was "clean", well it was a very strong smell of bleach, made me gag.. Had to open all windows and have a beautiful view of what they called garden. More like over grown weeds that were dried out and dying. The room is rather spacious and comfortable. They had plates, fridge, microwave, small stove an 12 cup coffee maker. You are lucky to have a tiny small pouch of coffee for a single cup when it's a room that sleeps FOUR! The non coffee, more like dark water, was pathetic. They could a least have a bag of coffee that is for a full pot of coffee...c'mom! We had the discomfort for finding earwigs in the bedroom, through out the night and morning. Probably came in from the over grown brush garden. BE AWARE that the check out is a 10am... I know! I called front desk to ask (it

Summary Heading: Great location for Orange County destinations.
Summary: Near San Diego, Disneyland, Nixon Library and Museum. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's close to Grocery shopping and the Outlet Mall and the Fisherman's restaurant on the pier. Nice pool and Spa. The grills use briquets but not gas. We would have preferred gas. The wi-fi required a very long password which was a little irritating but not a deal breaker.

Summary Heading: Property is nice, always good, but management style needs to change.
Summary: Probably our 6th stay here over the last 8 years (kids & grandkids at Camp Pendleton), but it will be our last.  The rooms are good, functional, I'd say an 8.5 out of 10, and the backyard grounds are a 9.5 and fun for families with kids: grills, shuffleboard, the pool & hot tub, putt-putt, picnic areas. The lobby and indoor activity area were under construction this trip, so some lost value there, but understandable and these changes happen, it's positive progress and all OK.  We were terribly bothered, however, by the 2 a.m. arrival of a group of young and loud guests next door on the second night of our 5 there - noisy enough to startle us awake, and after about 20-30 minutes of nonstop loud voices and doors slamming, we called the front desk to complain and ask for help. He

Everyone was really friendly and helpful. The room was great, but not easy to use the cooking facilities in the room. The facilities around the hotel were perfect. Swimming pool, tennis courts and other things. Easy access to the freeways driving too!

We loved our time here...can't recommend this place enough. We will definitely be back! Family friendly but the grounds are so big you hardly notice the kiddos. Heated pool, adult jacuzzi and separate kids jacuzzi. It's like an apt-home away from home. Hidden gem off the 5 fwy in South OC

Great environment wonderful staff very clean. The pool area is large with a adult hot tub and a kid Spa. Offers putt putt golf in a great BBQ area. Right down the street from the beach and the railroad tracks. Okay view from the balcony but there is a balcony so that's a plus two bathrooms which is awesome or in the morning great beds two Murphy Beds and a pull-out couch he could fit the whole family

My family stayed there for my husband's Marine Corps retirement! We loved it! Beautiful and affordable! We also enjoyed the Saturday night show!  This hotel is in an excellent location near the state park and easy access to the highway. Thank you for the lovely stay!

Our room was great! Perfect for a family with all of the amenities offered. Mini golf, basketball/tennis courts, and pool/hot tubs. The room was great with a fully stalked little kitchen so you could bring your own food. Lots of room and the shower head was actually good and strong which I've never had at a hotel before. Close to a lot. We drove to Legoland in 30 mins, Dana Point, and Laguna Beach. San Clemente State Beach is also right down the street and absolutely beautiful! There's a baby beach in the harbor at Dana Point with FREE PARKING and perfect for little ones. There's also the Ocean Institute at Dana Point. Will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Value for money, quiet and relaxing
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights. It is still under renovation so the reception was in a mobile trailer but it wasn't  a problem. All staff were friendly and helpful and when we reported that our door screen was broken they sent someone immediately to fix it. Pool is heated, plenty of chairs/sun beds poolside. Other complimentary activities include: tennis, mini golf, ping pong, weights room, quoits. Rooms may be dated (personal taste) but are not shabby, they are clean and in good condition. The beach is a 5-10 mins walk or you can take the car and park for 2 dollars an hour. Nice beach, lovely path next to the beach for walking/jogging/biking, plenty of public restrooms along the way. Strongly recommend Fisherman's Restaraunt on the pier for superb meal. Adele's  restaraunt next door

Summary Heading: Very Nice Rooms but Lots of Rules and Hooks
Summary: The San Clemente Inn was probably the resort to go to in the 70's.   Pros The motel is close to the 101 but we heard no real noise due to good insulation.  Lots of parking and a good rate.  The room was a studio and very, very  clean.  Everything appeared new.  New light fixtures, lamps, cook top,  fridge.  The small kitchen had wood like floors with all appliances and everything you would need to cook.  The bedroom part had carpet, two small recliners, flat screen tv, and a platform bed.  Queen bed mattress seemed new.  Four pillows (nice). The room has a large balcony with an ocean view in the distance.  The motel backs up to the state park so if you get in the back the view is even better.  Lots of storage space and four beach towels on top of the bath towels.  No tub but

Summary Heading: Great resort style property near beach
Summary: My spouse had mentioned he had stayed at this property some 30 years ago, we have always wanted to stay here.  With that in mind (the 30 years), this property is currently undergoing renovations (as of April 2017).    Keep in mind that the check-in process is in a temporary storage container (see picture) located at the front of the property.  It actually looks like at first blush that it might be part of the renovations, but there are small red/white signs with arrows directing you to the building.  Check in was easy though.  A note as far as billing, they required a security deposit of $50 something that showed up on our credit card, but it was credited back in less than 24 hours (be mindful of that).     Despite the renovations, we were amazed at how well kept the property

To be honest this may not be the best review as they are currently under renovation. The reception was in a mobile trailer and was OK but nothing to write home about.  The room was clean and neat. The shower had little pressure but that is probably do to the CA water shortage. Our room did have a refrigerator, microwave, small stove and dishwasher. No elevators to the second or third floors. The wi-fi was extremely frustrating as it kept dropping the connection and had to re-log in and the password was long and frustrating to get back on. There were tennis courts, basketball court, a sort of miniature golf area, ping pong tables and shuffle board. The pool was pretty good with two spas, one for kids and one for adults. It is right next to the State park (walking distance) and a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. I regret to hear that your stay was not all you had hoped it would be. However, we appreciate your honesty as your comments will help to improve the resort.

Summary Heading: Good and bad. It's all how you look at it.
Summary: Property is located at southern, quiet, end of San Clemente just off I-5. Located on hillside overlooking San Clemente State Park about 5 blocks from Calafia Beach. Old-style 3-decker barracks style, currently under major remodel of lobby area. Office is in a portable office container in parking lot. Room good but dated, with a lot of noise transference. Bed firm with updated bedding but accent pillows soiled and stained. Landscaping nice but neglected. Roadside sign lights are half out. Pool area good but fence gate broken.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the San Clemente Inn. We are disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your stay, but appreciate your feedback.

Summary Heading: Well located and spacious but not luxurious
Summary: A good option for staying at San Clemente, the suites are somewhat small, but more than adequate for a couple or a young family looking for a location close to the beach with kitchen eat-in facilities.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review regarding your recent stay with us. We are happy to hear the accommodations worked well for you. We hope you can visit us again in the future.

Summary: Great room, great staff, great parking, great location 2 mins from beach, good restaurant on site, everything worked out perfect,  (I'm Trying to get the 200 word minimum so this bit isn't really worth reading)
Manager Response: Glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at the San Clemente Inn. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Put the sun in San Clemente
Summary: Want a great location , with super staff inside and out,, Go to the San Clemente Inn and really relax and enjoy Southern California. Staff are all courteous and friendly from check in to housekeeping.  The type of  local and international guests there were also sociable and easy to  visit  with. Location is close to beaches, shops, restaurants and local area attractions.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. We are happy to hear your stay with us was a memorable one! We hope you will consider us again in the future for your travels.

Summary: The staff was friendly and cooperative. A problem with the TV and DVD player were quickly resolved . The week was relaxing in a clean, well maintained unit. The entertainment at Adelle's Friday and Saturday nights was very enjoyable.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review! We look forward to seeing you here again!

Summary Heading: Comfortable, fun, near a State Park
Summary: This Inn is right next to the San Clemente Beach Park and it is possible to walk there. It is also near the San Clemente Beach path to the Pier. It is also easy to hop right on I5. Everything was good, except that the property is old and the very large, nice veranda is also needing some maintenance. We were surprised to find a construction trailer instead of a lobby, but I guess their renovations will be done soon.

Our room was huge! It wasn't actually one room but a bedroom, kitchenette, sitting room, bathroom and another loo room, a balcony. All very clean and comfy. A walk to the beach was about 10 minutes. It is a lovely place and would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: A Fun Week in the Sun
Summary: We went to San Clemente to get away from awful winter weather, and we were not disappointed with our last minute find of the San Clemente Inn.  The lobby and some amenities were closed for remodeling, but there was still plenty to do (pool, hot tub, mini golf, shuffleboard, dvd rentals, tennis and ping pong), not to mention walking distance from the beach.  There was always friendly staff to help with whatever one might need and housekeeping came everyday to change towels and make beds. The 1BR/1Bath unit we had only had a little kitchenette area, but it was adequate, the water pressure in the shower was good, and the bed slept pretty well.  It's not real modern or fancy, but it was very comfortable.  I'd certainly go there again!

My husband and I were delighted in our accomondations at San Clemente Inn. We stayed in a studio room. The room was very clean and designed well for a busy travel. The kitchen was stocked with assortment of kitchen supplies. There is a two burner electric stove, microwave, sink and full size refrigerator. They office has many dvd's you can borrow. They even have relatively newer movies. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The grounds were beautiful by the pool, mini golf and skeet board area. The Inn is located a few miles from the pier and Del Mar street. Definitely will return.

Summary Heading: nice view and room on west side upper level
Summary: This resort is still going through a long term remodel and the main lobby and activity area was still under redo. The male host staff were not very conscious of their service role, but the ladies were excellent and helpful.  The tv system leaves a lot to be desired and never worked well despite service person trying. The room was very nice with great views and privacy  from the balcony.  It is still hard to get luggage around due to no elevators and luggage carriers. I still liked it overall.

Summary Heading: Stayed here on a timeshare exchange for a week-- won't be back
Summary: Our experience was completely average to below average.  We are owners of a timeshare in Capistrano and thought we'd pay extra to stay down the coast and have a change of scenery.  Unfortunately, our week there was not worthy of being in the same category as our Capistrano condo-- it was similar to a low-budget motel AND OFFERS NO ELEVATORS.  The appearance was off putting, the check-in location and process was off putting, the staff was off putting (with the exception of the repairman ARA who was great when we found the kitchen sink handle was completely broken off), the room was underwhelming, and the location wasn't ocean view.  In fact, upon check-in, we were told only 2 rooms in the entire facility are ocean view-- so don't go with any expectations of getting a view.  The

Easy to get to, near everything, helpful staff, clean and quiet. A good place to bring the wife or the whole family. Amenities include mini golf, shuffleboard, BBQ grills, a restaurant and more. Just off the five freeway, but also just a few minutes from the beach.

From the beginning the staff is quick, friendly and helpful. The breaker suite has a nice large open living space with a separate bedroom. A large patio that looked out upon the week kept grounds with gazebos, mini golf and more.

Working on remodeling. according to what we heard they are going to invest millions on upgrades. Stayed in a newley remodeled suite. Only thing that is we did not have much of a view. But it was close to the parking lot for my wife. Housekeeping was wonderful. Our requests were answered right away. Ate at the restaurant there "Adele"s, Good breakfast and the owner was very friendly. well kept grounds but wish they had gas grills to cook with. It rained 2 days we were there (rare for Cal). there is a great Oceanside path to walk close to resort.

Summary Heading: A pleasant Stay at San clemente Inn
Summary: We found san Clemente Inn a very convenient location to take in the sites of San Clemente, Dana Point and San Juan Capistrano.  the staff were very friendly and helpful and even though we were there for a short stay of two nights, housekeeping called on us to see if we needed anything.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your stay. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: The inn is right off the beach and walking path. They have a wonderful pool and hot tub area. The lower courtyard is well groomed with comfortable cabanas, with soft couches and chairs. They are well located near La and San Diego.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with the San Clemente Inn! Thank you for your response. We look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary: This place is the best kept secret in California.  The location between L.A and San Diego offers opportunities for short commutes to the big cities before returning to this quaint Inn.  Amazing room views and service minded staff.  Looking forward to returning in the future.
Manager Response: Glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at the San Clemente Inn. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The location and hotel amenities were perfect. Very affordable and a very short walk/car ride to downtown San Clemente and the beach. Only con is, it is under construction and it did not say that anywhere on the website.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your stay. We hope you come back to see the new remodeled lobby and rec-room.

Summary: 1/4 mile from a state park and the beautiful Pacific ocean and beach, the drawback is there is limited metered parking, on the positive side you can walk from your room. The park has a refreshment stand, public restrooms, park rangers and security.  Your have a wide assortment of rooms available, poolside etc. There is a putting golf course, tennis in the court yard, swimming pool and  two hot tubs, one for the younger children and one for the older guests. There are private picnic areas as well as grills for the guests. They also have a restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. There are many local restaurants   with a wide variety of cuisines. Shopping centers and movie theaters as well as the Richard Nixon Presidential Museum.  The staff are wonderful and there is

Summary: Great location..too bad mgmt. did not plan better for activities that were lost. Rec room, games, movies, common areas all under construction..how hard to keep games, movies, books out for guests? you know the time frames, plan ahead
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the San Clemente Inn. We are disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your stay, but appreciate the feedback.  In regards to the above comments. The Rec Room is closed, however we still have other activities available. The activities you mentioned are available at the front desk. I apologize if you were not informed. Please feel free to reach out to management by contacting the resort to discuss further. We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: San Clemente Inn is a great location for a relaxing stay.  The staff was wonderful. The property is older, but well maintained and updated. The beach is a five-minute walk away and I-5 is only five minutes.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. I am also happy to know that our staff was helpful in making your stay a memorable one. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: We stayed here due to a water leak at our home, which is within walking distance of the Inn. We were completely satisfied. The bed is a bit hard, but after one night it was fine. We have decided we will use the San Clemente Inn for visiting relatives in the future!! The unit was large, the efficiency kitchen was great, and my daughter slept great on the Murphy bed. Easy check-in, and no complaints.

Our experience at your inn was a romantic getaway.  We found the room to be exceptionally clean and well maintained.  The furnishings were very comfortable and up to date. The grounds were beautiful to view from our balcony and were delight to walk through.  The staff were very helpful and courteous and tried hard to please us. Overall we are very pleased with the inn and will stay with you again.

We visited San Clemente just after Christmas, the weather was fantastic and the San Clemente Inn was great. We had a mini suite that sleeps 4, it had 2 bathrooms and a kitchenette. The room was very spacious. The pool area had pool, spas, one for adults and one for children, shuffleboard and a mini golf course.  They even have DVDs to borrow. Excellent location about 1 mi from state beach and 2 mi from San Clemente pier. It is located right off the 5. We will stay there again.

We had a wonderful stay at this cute smaller hotel. We were on the 3rd floor with an ocean view. Room was well appointed, comfortable, and included daily basic housekeeping. Walking distance to the beach, where there is a 2+ mile pathway/trail. Downtown San Clemente has cute shops and restaurants, worth the short drive. Outlets, movies, Trader Joe's, and Costco are also nearby. PCH is a lovely drive going north and south. We hope to return.

Summary Heading: Depending on your room.... Still under renovations
Summary: Let me start by saying all staff members were great- polite,helpful,etc. we stayed in a lovely renovated room with a fantastic view of the ocean and sunset off the balcony. It was all newly redone,and very pleasant.The view was amazing-but as noted,it all depends. It appeared that many of the rooms have no such luck with views,so ask at CHECKIN,it really matters here. Some just faced a dank little scrub brush filled inner courtyard,others were literally almost I underground.(big hills here) b/c we had a 3rd floor room with a great view, we liked this place. Getting some of those other rooms we saw would have been a miserable experience.(3rd floor room 353 is perfect) the front of hotel is all a construction zone,yellow tape,ports potties,lots of workmen buzzing around. The bed we had at SCI was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in away from home.  It was a great stay! The only issue was a problem with the Wifi the first two days but after that, NO PROBLEMS at all.  Adjacent to San Clemente State Park and Beach, who could want for anything more!

Location: Perfect! Just a short drive from Temecula. Temecula has some of the best wineries, Prestiges Pechanga Casino, and old town that has so much stuff to do there. Resort is not far from Dana Point which is a must visit type of place . Downtown San Clemente offered nice restaurants and shops which we loved. We had a private beach walking distance from our resort it was beautiful to watch the sunset from there.  Staff: Friendly, welcoming, attentive to all our needs.  Room: Recently remodeled rooms, spacious, clean and comfortable. Everything you need is in the room. Some parts of the place is still undergoing a face lift. Cant wait to see the the finished look when we return.  Comments: We stayed for a week my husband and I. I highly recommend this place to couples or

I stayed at the San Clemente Inn for a couple days while repairs were being completed at my apartment. Let me be the first to say that my experience was amazing. It started with the friendliness and professionalism of the staff. The front desk attendant was very informative and helpful with information about the property and the area attractions. Upon arriving to my room, I noticed the cleanliness and welcoming atmosphere. I was upgraded to one of their Crest rooms which sleeps 6 people. I didn't know that the rooms were fully equipped with a stove, microwave, dishwasher and all the necessities of that of an apartment! The only thing I would suggest is larger TVs! The balcony in my room was large and provided an excellent view of the sunset. I would recommend San Clemente Inn to

Summary Heading: Thanks to all the staff for being GREAT!
Summary: The place is headed towards a remodel that sounds great.  The Saturday night show would have been fun but was closed for the holiday. The staff were all very nice and helpful.  The gardens are lovely. Parking was great.

We enjoyed our stay. We liked the murphy beds in the room because they saved floor space. The heated pool was nice for our kids and we were able to rent DVDs at no cost for those nights we wanted to stay in our room.

We had an ocean view from our 1 bedroom suite with cooktop, frig, microwave and coffee pot. Private bedroom and two Murphy beds in living/dining area.  Full bath plus additional separate vanity area. While not fancy, nicely furnished and very clean. Well-kept property with nice outdoor space for families with younger children (or low-key boomers). Good beach access downhill and in nearby areas. Easy access to local restaurants and grocery.
Manager Response: Glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at the San Clemente Inn. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I have stayed here before and have always been beyond pleased. I had to fly into town for a few nights and I love this place. The staff is so friendly and inviting. Very close to the beach! Thanks San Clemente Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: This is my second time to the Inn and I was even more pleased then the first. The staff is accommodating and gracious. They upgraded me for FREE and checked me into one of their new renovated rooms, which was pretty awesome! as usual the inn is a cheep Uber or Lift into to town with ample Bars and restaurants  and once your in town its walking distance to pretty much anything or anywhere you'd like to go! San Clemente is always a blast! Can't wait for my next visit XOXO! Viva la San Clemente inn !
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your stay. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary Heading: A great place to stay; This is not a luxury hotel.
Summary: The San Clemente Inn was everything that I read from other reviews.  The staff is very accommodating and friendly.  The property is very dated, but the rooms are clean.  The rates are great for the value.  The San Clemente community is beautiful.  The grocery store, Walmart and Target are not far.  You can walk down to the pier and have lunch or dinner at the Fisherman‚Äôs Restaurant. The property is small, but well-kept and conveniently located.  This is not a luxury hotel.  Ask for a room with a view of the putt-putt course.

We spent 8 days at San Clemente Inn and enjoyed every minute. Just blocks from the beach and with all the amenities, our time couldn't have been better. One minor instance, we seldom watched either of the two flat screen TV's but we turned one on to the weather channel to keep track of a storm that was to hit our home. The cable stopped functioning after an hour or so. A call to maintenance had a new cable box and the TV up and running in 15 minutes. All the folks who work at the Inn were wonderful. We'd definitely recommend the resort to anyone.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and for sharing your experience with us. I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that you were pleased with our staff's service. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: The Inn is very dated and run down. And the customer service from Lisa, the General Manager was atrocious!  The units get hot in warm weather.  The bedroom is far away from the small wall unit A/C, so gets little of the effect.  And our bedroom window opened to a common walkway and parking lot, which was loud.  When I asked the front desk for a fan, I was told they had none.  I was also informed that my unit was one of a few units that have no ceiling fan in the bedroom.  I then asked Lisa, the G.M., if she could please budget $30 or so to purchase a fan.  She refused.  She suggested that we sleep on the fold out sofa bed in the frontroom, or purchase our own fan.  She showed absolutely no concern for our discomfort.  I told her I had no way to take the fan on the plane if I
Manager Response: Dear Skittleslover,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the San Clemente Inn. We are disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your stay, but appreciate your feedback.  The San Clemente Inn rooms, as you mentioned, have individual A/C units not central air. This is commonly found in older properties. That said, although we are considered to be an older property we strive to keep our grounds and rooms well maintained and are consistently undergoing renovations to improve the property. The San Clemente Inn has a long presence within the community and is considered a staple to San Clemente locals.  We were also disappointed to hear that you felt you received poor service from Management. If this was the impression you were given it certainly was not our intent. The Management team strives to work with our guests in any situation in which they may be dissatisfied to provide a quick resolution to the issue at hand. Unfortunately, Management does not have the ability to purchase personal items for guests for the rooms. However, we do try to find alternative resolutions that will work for our guests in situations such as the one you encountered. We regret that Management was not able to address the manner in a way you felt appropriate.  Again, we thank you for staying at the San Clemente Inn and for taking the time to review your stay. Although you felt the stay could have been better, we appreciate your feedback as this allows us to continuously improve our resort.

Summary: This resort has just remodeled their rooms and they did a nice job, the unit looks great!  The mattresses are new and extremely comfortable.  There is a nice lawn area in the back with a gazebo, a pool, hot tubs and bar-b-ques which we use every year.  There is also a gym, and a recreation room with a pool table and other activities. The larger rooms have a small kitchenette in them.  It is just a short walk to the State Park next to the resort, which makes a nice easy walk for exercise.  There are beaches near-by and many nice restaurants in the area. We always enjoy our stay at the San Clemente Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your vacation. We hope to see you back in San Clemente soon!

Summary: Very nice play to stay and there are lots of free activities on the grounds. Kitchen was quite small and there was no oven, but otherwise it was a good use of the space available. We liked that we were able to get a room such that we would not have to climb a lot of steps. It would have been nice to have a view of the ocean but not possible. Staff were very nice and helpful.

Simple amenities at a good price. Abit close to the freeway so there is traffic noise.  Staff are very attentive.  Beach is within walking distance.  Pool, and spa was too cool for me but theres a game room, pool table, table tennis and tennis court.

Apartments are very well equipped and very comfortable!  Staff extreamely friendly   I think it was approx $120 all in for the evening  Pool is lovely   Walking distance from town  My only regret is that we only stayed the night!  Will be recommending San Clemente in 100% üòäüòä

We came down here to get away from the desert heat. First week we had a big 1 bedroom unit. Had a queen bed in bed room 2 fold down single beds and 1 queen sleeper sofa. All were new as they had just redone this building. There is a nice rec room a heated pool 80* all year an adult jacuzzi 102* and a kid jacuzzi 90*(per state law )  The kitchens are small 2 burner electric cook top a small sink small dishwasher a microwave and a medium sized fridge. Also has 1 and 1/2 baths. They have bbqs there for your usage All are charcoal and you must suply your own charcoal lighter fluid and matches  They have a restaurant on site but we didn't eat there think it's called Adeles.  The second week we were in the next size smaller unit mostly the same only no sleeper sofa less counter space
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. I am happy to hear that our rooms met your needs during your vacation. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: GREAT WEEK AT SAN CLEMENTE INN
Summary: We enjoyed our 1 bedroom condo last week.  It had one full bedroom and a murphy bed in the living room, which was actually quite comfortable. The partial kitchen is small with no oven, but worked fine for us. The large balcony overlooked their fun 9 hole miniature golf course and sparkling pool. The resort was near shopping, new outlets, movie theater not too far and beautiful sandy beach around the corner. Will hope to come back soon!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review! We look forward to seeing you here again!

Summary Heading: Close to beach, clean and comfy
Summary: Staff including maintenance and housekeeping, very friendly. Loved our week long stay. Room was comfy even the 2 Murphy beds. Housekeeping daily. Beach is less then 5 minutes away with the best sunset views. Mini golf, ping pong and shuffleboard all included with a beautiful crystal clean pool. My 88 year old mom loved the easy walk to the car from handicapped accessible room. Large bathroom too. 2 TVS make it nice for all. Sturdy furniture, 6 chair at table, 2 couches.  IF there is a negative to post, we were in the 200 section of the hotel. Our view was "ok". There is a section of the grounds, (possible State Park property) nevertheless in our daily site. There is trash, bottles, clothes thrown over the balconies. Not pretty to see among the natural landscape.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. I am happy to hear that our rooms met your needs during your vacation. I am also happy to know that our staff was helpful in making your stay a memorable one. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: We love breakfast at Adeles! Best hotel and location in San Clemente. Adeles is inside lobby. Close to beaches parks beach trail family friendly. Easy access to transportation . Amenities include pool and spa.

We had a spacious room that would accommodate a family with three children. It had been refurbished fairly recently. The resort is west of the freeway meaning easy access to the beach. There is a cafe on site where people can purchase breakfast or lunch.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding your stay at the San Clemente Inn. We hope you will consider us again during your future travels!

Summary: Staff was friendly, we showed up without a reservation, late at night and they were very helpful and accommodating.  Room setup is great, even when you have a big group and they are very clean which is a big plus.  We also had breakfast onsite at Adele's this time and it was great.  Love this place!
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. The San Clemente Inn is great for a weekend getaway or a long term stay. We are happy to hear you not only enjoyed the amenities, but our staff as well. Visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Close to freeway, close to beaches
Summary: Very close to beaches and you can walk to state park located behind resort. Easy on and off I-5. Resort is a little out dated but they have renovations starting soon.We did enjoy the quietness. Staff is helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that you were pleased with our staff's service. Please visit us again in the future

Summary: This hotel was very good. Simply called them up after 10pm and we got a fantastic room rate and amazing room. Only one room was left and it was the suit, the room rate was good for that area. Only the check out at 10 am was a little uncomfortable due that we just arrived during night and could not experience the whole facility.

Summary Heading: It is very good and relaxing
Summary: My grand daughter and I love to play mini golf. She also like to swim and the hot tub. You can play pool, ping pong ball, tennis there. The beach is very closer to San Clemente Inn. We went to the outlet in San Clemente. We will love coming back next year.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear your family enjoyed their stay with the San Clemente Inn!  Thank you for your response. We look forward to seeing you next year.

Summary: Will definitely return.  The only drawback was the price of the room.  It was kind of overpriced - will book much more in advance next time.  The hotel is not plush, but comfortable - it was quiet and the staff was awesome.

Great price, specially for being last minute on a busy Saturday. Check in was a breeze. Location was nice. Room was fine. Did have an issue with water coming out of the shower, but we did have a handicap shower, so that may have been the reason why.

Stayed here for 1 week from 8/14 to 8/21, great place for families with kids, lots of room and activities for kids, nice beaches close by, 1 bedroom unit was nicely renovated. Will come back next year.

The San Clemente Inn is a great respite for us, we love the beach walk, the pier, and  restaurants and antique stores in San Clemente.  Its a nice relaxing week for us and when we need advice and directions the staff are always accommodating and knowledgeable.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with the San Clemente Inn. The resort strives to provide our guests with the best possible customer service and experience that we can. We hope to serve you again during your future travels.

Summary: I recently held my Bachelor Party there.    It wasn't a blow out, loud, wasted one. I invited some close friends and we ate great food and played some board games.   No screaming/yelling/general obnoxiousness. As you can imagine, even though it wasn't crazy it is still a super important moment in my life.  IT WAS WONDERFUL. Could not have gone better.    Great location.  SO many amenities that we didn't get a chance to take advantage of (ping pong, pool, bar, miniature golf, tennis, basketball, etc.) and the rooms were HUGE!  I checked out three suites and the accommodations were terrific!  I would recommend this place any tourists that want to stay close to the beach, and great food.  I would also recommend them to any SoCal locals who just want to get away for the weekend.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review regarding your recent stay with us. We are happy to hear the accommodations worked well for you and your friends. We hope you can visit us again in the future.

Summary: It was recently renovated. it was very nice to stay for a week. It is a well-maintained, clean, and is in an almost perfect location. Beds are great!  will stay every year. FYI wifi was OK- not reliable.

The Inn is very convenient. The municipal golf course is very close and so is the beach and pier. There is a restaurant adjacent. This resort gives free DVDs for viewing. There is a great pool and 2 jacuzzis, one for adults,and one for kids. There is a pool table, air hockey, ping pong, tennis courts, and a basketball court. There is a weight room too. Great place for kids. My own kids had many happy summers there!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. We are happy to hear your stay with us was a memorable one! We hope you will consider us again in the future for your travels.

Summary: Great location to head North or South for site seeing. Best beaches in CA. Resort has everything from basketball, volleyball and tennis to pool tables air hockey pin pong phosball. Miniature golf and shuffle board. Room for plenty of activities including Bar B Qing. The BEST.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your vacation. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: Friendly staff, room was very big for the two of us, a bedroom & two twin sized pull out wall beds. They upgraded our room since we arrived so early. The on site restaurant was ok -- nothing to write home about. They were friendly there as well, bt make sure you tell them you are staying there to get a discount, we found out about that afterwards :| our room was perfect for what we needed at the time, post deployment mini vacation for the two of us, nice tv and comfortable living room area. The walls are thin, the family next to us was extremely loud and careless with door slamming day or night!

Been coming to SCI since mid-80's. It is a fun place and area reminiscent of Santa Monica in the 60's. Question is value and affordability with the homeowner dues. Still for activities, restaurants, proximity to Del Mar, I look forward to my week every year.

The one bedroom units comfortably sleeps four people.  The resort is a very short drive to the beach that is not very crowded. In addition to those that want to stay at the hotel the pool and Jacuzzi are quite comfortable. There's also a pool table, foosball table  and a nice air hockey machine.  There is also an extensive DVD library as well as a tennis court basketball court and mini golf course for the kids. The executive kitchen is quite suitable for making simple meals.   Although there is no oven there's a full-size refrigerator as well as a stove and a microwave.   It's a good value and highly recommended.

Great location, close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. Nice pool and tennis courts on sight. Anticipating some nice upgrades in the near future. Staff was friendly. Beds were ok as far as comfort goes. Kitchen was adequate, just small.

Ok...I'll be honest.  If I'm vacationing with just my hubby and myself, I want a 5 star hotel with all the beauty, perfection and perks, but if I'm vacationing with the entire family, I just want a separate room for us and all the "fun amenities" possible for the entire family to do together.  (It's expensive to find a hotel with a separate room!!)  This was a great hotel for the family!  We live in Southern CA, so when we saw there was a beautiful forecast for the month of February, we looked online and found the San Clemente Inn.  It's an older hotel but very clean and quiet.  It wasn't the nicest hotel we've ever stayed at but we all had a great time and the kids still talk about it.  My husband and I had our own room.  (Small, but private.)  The kids each had their own

So we have a time share.  Actually we have a couple.  What a mistake those were.  Anyway, it is next to impossible to exchange them into Southern California.  That said, we managed to exchange a week into the San Clemente Inn.  I bet this place was incredible in 1982.   Today, it is perfectly fine.  You aren't exactly on the beach, the room isnt exactly great.  We could sleep 5 comfortably though.  The restaurant is a little unusual but will sell you a to-go cup with free refills for 3.50 and they are really nice.   Strangely, there are absolutely no trashcans anywhere.   Our kids had fun with the shuffleboard and goofy golf.   I can't say I would pay a lot to stay here but I can't say it was bad.  I would go back with the kids, I wouldn't take the wife there for a romantic

Great place to stay and relax. The grandkids had fun playing tennis, swimming, and playing miniature golf. The bbq pits were great for our late afternoon dinners. Perfect place to go and relax.Beach was close buy, as well as shops for window shopping.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your vacation. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: It's a small old property, right off the freeway. It's well maintained. Nothing luxurious about it but quite convenient if you're looking for a lower budget accommodation.  The kitchen with fridge and stove are of a decent size. And it's Jay 10 minutes away from the beach.

Confortable and clean beds, many ammenities, nice swimming pool and jacuzzy. This place has everything you need to spend a great time away from home! And is even at walking distance from the beach. I'll recommended highly.
Manager Response: Glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at the San Clemente Inn. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This timeshare hotel is a few blocks from the beach, but there is a parking lot at the end of the street by the ocean if you wish to drive.  It is a bit old, but has been updated frequently.  It is close to the freeway, but I don't recall that being an issue.  Front desk does try to accommodate.  A one or two bedroom unit would be best, because studios are really limited in space.  There is a walking trail by the beach, nice foe early morning walks.  There are no views from any room, except the pool or foliage.

Be careful not to mention any displeasure with your stay otherwise you'll be BALCK LISTED and front desk and staff will be notified to singling you out for the rest of your stay.   This place is a time share acting as a hotel (that means ZERO service ZERO hospitality) and doing a very poor job of it.   Definition of  hospitality:  noun  1. the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers.  They sell most off their rooms on Groupon. It's obvious they can't arrack anyone as a traditional hotel.   My experience isn't as important as your upcoming stay, I can't do anything about my stay BUT YOU CAN.   They are Paranoid.... They have signs all over the place warring you your car maybe towed away, they can refuse you service, that will charge you
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are sorry to hear that your experience was not what you had hoped, but appreciate your feedback as we consistently strive to provide all of our guests with a memorable experience.
