In regards to your statements about Groupon, the resort does do four sales a year with them, however, we are also listed on many other sites such as Expedia, Orbitz, and Booking.com. Guests are also welcome to call the resort directly to reserve or go on our website. In addition, as you stated we did have signs up around the property reminding our guests to place their parking pass on the dash of their car. These signs were only up for the week of Fourth of July. Unfortunately, due to our proximity to the beach, we do encounter a significant amount of traffic from beach goers who are not staying at the resort, but try to park in our lot. This is especially prevalent during Summer holidays. Therefore, we do everything we can to remind our guests to make sure their pass is visible, to avoid accidental towing.   Lastly, I apologize you were unable to try our cafe in the lobby due to the check out time. If you do choose to stay with us in the future, please ask the morning of departure if a later check out is available. We do offer late check outs on a first call first serve basis and only a certain number are authorized within a given day. If you are unable to receive a late check out, we would be more than happy to store your luggage while you enjoy your breakfast!  Again, thank you for taking the time to review your experience. If you would like to discuss your stay further, please contact management at 949-492-6103.

Summary: Our family of six stayed at the San Clemente Inn for a week. This is our fifth year in a row. We love it. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. There are lots of great amenities, including a swimming pool, a tennis court, shuffle board, ping pong, air hockey, and workout equipment.  The hotel is within walking distance of the beautiful Calafia beach.
Manager Response: Thank you John for taking the time to review your recent stay. I am happy to hear that our rooms met your needs during your vacation. I am also happy to know that our staff was helpful in making your stay a memorable one.

Summary: My family stayed in two rooms for a week and had the best experience!  The staff was very accommodating and placed us in rooms very close together.  There were activities during the week (candy bingo was a big hit with the kids) and in addition to a big pool there are two jacuzzi spas - one for adults and one for kids.  My grandson had the best time in the kids jacuzzi.  We received clean beach towels every day and the rooms were great for our family.  We definitely will look to booking again to enjoy the cool beach weather during the hot summer months.

The Inn is older than most. However, it has great historical background. It was well maintained and we were in an updated room.  The Murphy Beds were a great idea for adding sleep accomodations.  The bath towels were nice and large, not the skimpy little towels that won't even fit around a normal body.  I liked the idea of having a commode and sink separate from a complete full bathroom.  The staff were very informative and the restaurant on site is a real convenience.  The Saturday night show was a real fun event.

Summary Heading: You can't beat the San Clemente Inn
Summary: Love this place, love the people, walk every day, to beach, pier and back, great restaurants nearby, BBQ, miniature golf on premises, warm pool, nice spas.  Easy parking, next to State Beach, easy drive to Surf beach and downtown.

I love it here! I feel safe and like family! My parents bought into the new idea of a time share in 1984. I'm so thankful that they did. I now bring my kids and even grandkids to this relaxing and friendly resort!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the San Clemente Inn. We are thrilled to hear our hotel provided your family with a great stay. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: My new wife and I stopped here near the end of a CA road trip we did for our honeymoon. Our goal along the way was to find hidden treasures (non chain hotels) and this was probably the highlight of the trip. We stumbled across it by accident after stopping at the exit and heading down to the beach. I figured being so close to the beach, it might be out of our price range but my wife said she would check. She came back to say that they had a room but it was for sleeping 6, but we could have it for $130. That's pretty cheap for being so close to the ocean so we asked if we could see a room (I thought it must be a dump!). The room they showed us was beautiful. Newly remodeled with a queen bed in a separate bedroom, jack and jill bathrooms, a sofa bed and two Murphy beds that pulled
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. We are happy to hear your stay with us was a memorable one! We hope you will consider us again in the future for your travels.

Summary: I was very pleased with our accommodations.  I was not sure since RCI rated this as a three star.  It was above my expectations. I loved e location and closeness to the beach and quaint little town.  There is so much to do.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review! We look forward to seeing you here again!

Summary: We had a great stay at San Clemente Inn! We had a nice, clean room and had lots to do around the facility; pool, tennis courts, mini golf, etc. Easy, close access to the beach was our favorite part! There was also good restaurants and shops close by. We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with the San Clemente Inn. Please come back and see us again soon!

Summary: We have been coming to San Clemente every summer for 20+ years. This is our first time staying at the San Clemente Inn. It was absolutely perfect! We will stay here from now on! Super friendly staff, spacious, comfy rooms, and gorgeous views!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and for sharing your experience with us. I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that you were pleased with our staff's service. Please visit us again in the future.

Summary: Fun mini vacation getaway for anyone wanting a day or two just for relaxation. My husband and I did this and happy we did. There's a mini kitchen in your room if you choose to cook there. Fully stocked kitchen items like a microwave, toaster, coffee maker, utensils, cups, plates, pots and pans you get the picture. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are not that bad. It was very clean and was told they had a remodel. I liked it, and was happy.   There's a big pool, mini golf, tennis courts, BBQ outs throughout the grounds if you choose to take food and cook outdoors. Great for large parties. There's a jacuzzi, sitting areas and gazebos. They also have shuffleboard which is fun to play. All things fun and relaxing. It was enjoyable and I would do again. You can also rent for
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the San Clemente Inn. We are delighted to hear our hotel provided your family with a great stay. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The best value for your money, and within walking distance to the beach.  We have stayed here for the past 3 years now.  The staff is very friendly and housekeeping does a fantastic job.  The grounds are well cared for and well lit- which makes it feel very secure.  The rooms are very clean, spacious and offer all the comforts of home (there are guest washers/dryers on the property).  We really love sitting on our private balcony every morning and listening to the ocean.  There is even an ocean view from some rooms.  The property is very quiet (it backs up to a state park which makes it even better!).  There is ample parking for you and any guests you invite over.  We have enjoyed the hot tubs and pool, but have never used their other recreational activities (shuffle board, mini
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your vacation. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: Don't let the outside of the hotel / resort fool you.  It might look like apartment buildings but the inside is not that bad.  Got this deal on Groupon and it was ok for what I paid. We got a queen room with double Murphy beds which can hold 4 people total in the room. Nice little living room area, microwave fridge and burners.   This is a nice place if you have a family and are going to be at the beach down the street.  There is only one thing to do around here and it's the beach, there's not much to do besides that.  The resort does have mini golf, shuffle board, tennis and basketball courts but nothing amazing.   I liked the secluded beach down the street.   The biggest thing I didn't like was the fact that check in is at 4pm and check out is at 10am!!   If you can get a deal

I really like this place.  Will go back again as much as I am able. Front office staff (Susan) is friendly and welcoming.   Whole atmosphere in lobby is warm and inviting.   Restaurant on site highly rated.  Miniature golf course very nice.   Pool area clean.  Outside well maintained.   Recreation area good for all ages. Rooms are very comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear Carol:  Thank you so much for your great review!  We look forward to seeing you here again!

Summary: This hotel is very clean and tidy.  It comes fully stocked with dishes and cookery. The beds are very comfortable as well. It is close to the beach and restaurants as well. It is a place I will return to.
Manager Response: Dear Monica:  Thank you so much!  We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: Not sure what to expect.  First time in CA and found this Inn on Groupon.  Wow, we're we impressed.  Our room was lovely, very clean and everything had been updated and was fresh and comfortable.  We had a serrate bedroom, 2 full baths plus a full living, dining and kitchen area.  This would be the perfect place to stay with a couple, a family (plenty of beds and storage) or as a destination for a family or friends reunion. Jacob was very helpful on the phone and when we arrived. The amenities; pool, game room, outdoor game boards, tennis, basketball‚Ä¶.plenty to keep you busy but also close to beaches and town.   Don't miss the Fisherman's Restaurant on pier 57.  The pier is nice to walk and the restaurant was yummy‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..particularly the birthday dessert they offer.  Wow!! The town
Manager Response: Hi Lisa:  So glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!  I wish you could have stayed longer too! Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Just barely OK ... Nothing to brag about.
Summary: Good bath and kitchen upgrades (counters, faucets, etc). Very poor bed and furniture.  Asked for a foam mattress topper as the bed was horribly firm, and received it, only to find that the mattress already had been covered with a topper... It was BAD. He "housekeeping" service includes straightening the bed and changing the towels.  Any cleaning during your stay, including loading the dishwasher costs extra... read the fine print on the flier left in your room!  Game room is worn out. Would not stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Touchous,  Thank you for taking the time to review the San Clemente Inn. We are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay, but appreciate you bringing these issues to our attention. Please also note, that this month all of our bedroom mattresses in our rooms are being replaced to increase our guest's comfort. In addition, this year the resort plans to undergo several renovations that include our lobby and recreation room.   We hope that you will give us the opportunity to better serve you in the future if you come back to visit San Clemente. If you would like to discuss your stay further, management can be reached at 949-492-6103.  Again thank you for taking the time to provide the resort with your most honest experience. By providing feedback, we can better serve all of our travers during their stay.

Summary: Could not be happier with the location. San Clemente is beautiful. The Inn was old but well kept. Many recreational things to do like tennis, basketball court, 9 hole miniature golf, pool tables, fooseball, gym, pool, whirlpool, sauna and gym.

We stayed here for a 3 day getaway that included business I had at MCB Camp Pendelton. We requested a remodeled room on ground floor and were not disappointed. All new inside of room. Including Murphy Beds {2}. and 1 bedroom but was not the most comfortable bed though. Did not eat at on site dining spot but in town at South of Nicks, Sonnys and The Fisherman, see reviews I did for those spots. Hotel was uncrowded but in the summer prices go way up along with tourists.  We used Grupon for $50.00 a nite. Well worth it. Staff was friendly and nice. We will return for sure during non peak season.

I used Groupon for my stay at the San Clemente Inn.  The property was awesome. There is plenty to do while there. There's basketball, mini golf, shuffle board, a nice pool with kids whirlpool separate from the adults which is nice.  They also have a large movie library if you want to check out a movie. The room was a little dated, but I understand there will be a lot of updating in the next year.  The room we had could sleep six comfortably.  Having another toilet with nice sink in addition to the main bathroom was great. We thought the balcony was very large and looked over the grounds.   Everyone was very helpful with directions or whatever we needed.  We will be happy to stay there again if we make it back to California.

This hotel was very nice.  It has a pool, spas, miniature golf, free movies,  bbqs etc.  Grounds are really nice.  So much to do right on premises.  Even has a restaurant.  It is very close to a nice beach and semi walking to town or pier.  Also right next to a camp ground if needed.  If your a family looking for a get away, this is it you never have to go any where else.

Summary Heading: Large Rooms Great for a Family Trip - Being Renovated
Summary: This is a timeshare resort that rents out spare rooms as a hotel - as a result the rooms are large with small kitchenettes so it is ideal for a family stay.  The Inn  is within a 5 minute walk to the beach. While the room we stayed in was a bit dated overall the hotel was being upgraded, It also had a  friendly staff.  It is right off the  i5 and very easy to find.  There is a restaurant onsite  but as we were attending a wedding and visiting relatives we had no chance to try it. ( They did have some sort of Drag Queen show one of the nights though - looked like fun!)

Mike (management) was very gracious and greeted us upon arival... the area is paradise and it was great to come back to a place like home... thanks Mike... we will be back again... didn't  see any of the other things others said... too much fun...

My check in process was pleasant as the front desk staff was friendly.  Was surprised to be informed that I received a room upgrade.   My room was practically a 1 bedroom studio apartment with a large balcony.  Very cool!  Room came with all ammenities including pots, pans, plates, refrigerator/freezer, microwave, etc.  You essentially have everything you need (except for a pen- I was not able to find a pen for the life of me.  Just a note SCI staff ;-)  Pros: Friendly service Spacious room Clean Plenty of thing's to do without leaving hotel (ie; pool, mini golf, shuffleboard, tennis, etc) I got a great deal on my room DVD library at front desk.  All current/recent titles to watch in your room- great feature!  Cons: Bed was a bit rough- hard Check in not until 4 pm Check out no

Summary Heading: Not the cleanest hotel and more like a 2 star at best $40-$50 tops
Summary: Room was not clean at all and needs updating. Found many bugs crawling around and worried for bed bugs. Hotel needs a lot of work on the rooms to clean up the bug problems. Pool was nice and people very friendly, but hotel needs works on the rooms and cleanliness areas. Bad rating because this is where we sleep! This inn is overpriced for the quality and just all I can say is make sure you find a room (if any) that are bug infested free. We can't stand bugs and old beds for $100 a night room!

We had a studio room and it was awful. Sliding door did not close properly (maintenance did fix that). Rust in sink, bugs in sink, stains on carpets, very old furniture, mattress just sitting on piece of plywood. Absolute disgrace. We left and stayed in a hotel.

The room was well equipped, the kids had endless options for fun, the staff was very laid back and friendly.The rooms were quiet and the beds were very comfortable.The grounds are large and the location is convenient  to the beach and downtown. We will definitely be returning! Excellent value.

It's not a 5 star, but it is clean and in a great location.  Nice pool, jacuzzi, clean rooms... No great restaurant on premises but plenty of options near by. Close to the beach and trails... The Mission as an Juan Capistrano is a real jewel!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that our accommodations worked for you during your vacation. We hope to see you back in San Clemente soon!

Summary: I would recommend this to anyone who wants a kitchenette and wants to be close to the beach. Housekeeping was excellent and staff friendly and helpful. San Clemente is only a short ride north to Disney Land and short ride south to San Diego. Lots of places to eat.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding your stay at the San Clemente Inn. I am thrilled to hear that our staff provided you with great service. We hope you will consider us again during your future travels!

Summary: Great value for your buck!!! Just off the highway. Close to the beach. Plenty of parking, a nice restaurant at the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to my family and friends anytime thry are in the area!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. The staff and management is happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and hope you will return to the San Clemente Inn again in the future. We are also thankful for your support in recommending our hotel to your family and friends. Take care!

Summary: The room was very spacious with just the right amenities, The refrigerator was the largest I have ever seen in a hotel. The kitchen had everything but an oven.  It had a cooktop and A dishwasher and a microwave. Also dishes and silverware. The beds were comfortable. It is very nice to have Murphy Beds. It makes for more room . The balcony was huge with chairs.
Manager Response: Thank you Elaine for taking the time to review your recent stay. I am happy to hear that our rooms met your needs during your vacation. I am also happy to know that our staff was helpful in making your stay a memorable one. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: The room was very clean and very large. There was a full kitchen and two Murphy's beds. A family of four could have stayed here comfortably. There were are lots of activities (miniature golf, tennis courts, small basketball court, shuffle board, ping pong table, and pool tables). There are also few recent movies. It is definitely a place we would stay again.
Manager Response: Hi Lee! Thank you for your kind review. The San Clemente Inn does have quite a few activities/amenities onsite for our guests and we are happy to hear this made your stay a pleasant one! We hope you will consider the Inn again in future travels.

Summary: The resort was conveniently located between my family and attractions that we wanted to visit.  Our room comfortably fit all 6 of us; we didn't feel like we were on top of each other. The kids loved the shuffle board and miniature golf.  The beach was so close to the hotel. We would definitely come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the San Clemente Inn. We are delighted to hear our hotel provided your family with a great stay. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice accommodations with fridge, stove, microwave, and dishwasher. Two tVs. -business centre where one can use computer (free) Spacious apartment.. Comfortable double bed in one room, and comfortable murphy bed in living area. -free parking -free wi-fi -close to restaurants -great location -coin-operated laundries -great value -highly recommend (recommend apartment on main floor facing the room)
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and for sharing your experience with us. I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that you were pleased with our staff's service. Please visit us again in the future.

Summary Heading: An affordable jewel of the beach cities
Summary: It's a full resort for the price of a budget hotel!  Remodeled and chock full of activities on site. Landscaping is superb.  Helpful staff.  An employee even offered to help me bring my things into the room.  No added costs for wifi in rooms, miniature golf, shuffleboard, weight and exercise room,  pool and jacuzzi, Best in San Clemente rated breakfast/lunch and weekend entertainment restaurant on site, in suite full kitchen except for oven, daily maid service and more.  One bedrooms have privacy doors between beds for children and adults.   Timesharers have on site activities.  Overnight hotel guests are treated equally well.  Just down the hill (can be walked to save the $2.00 per hour beachfront parking) is the clean beach with walking path along the shore.  During summers
Manager Response: Thank you Melanie for sharing your experience with us. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the property. We work tirelessly making sure the property remains well maintained and that we can offer an excellent stay to our guests at an affordable price. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: This is a great little getaway. We stay here quite a lot. It has all the great things to make your life easier. Stovetop, refridgerator, microwave, coffee pot, dishwasher. We love it. It also has a pool and a Jacuzzi.
Manager Response: Thank you Susan. We are happy to hear you loved the property. The San Clemente Inn is great for a weekend getaway or a long term stay. We hope you not only enjoyed the amenities, but our staff as well. Visit us again soon!

Summary: Very close to the ocean. Many activities to do inside and out. The grounds were well kept. The room we had slept 6; although, the sleep sofa was not the most comfortable. The refrigerator n the room seemed to run constantly.

Upon arrival the young man at the front desk was UN-welcoming. Nothing about his attitude said WELCOME. No smile, didn't say HELLO. All I received , WHAT DO YOU NEED? a bit of customer service trainng and a smile would go a long way.   Was fully aware of the 10AMcheck-out policy (strange, as every other hotel I've ever stayed at give you until 11AM), but I called the front desk to request an additional half hour until 10:30 AM to check out. You would think I was asking for something so out of the based on the put out attitude I received from Julie, at the front desk. It was like pulling teeth! Truly, some respect and professionalism, common courtesy and customer sensitivity traing would again, go a tremendeous way toward good will to customers.   Good part was when I could,'t

Summary Heading: Our second visit to San Clemente Inn
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at San Clemente Inn. The hotel staff that greeted us were very friendly and helpful. The introduction meeting on Monday  to the amenities and  available activities was very interesting. Our family has been here before and still find it a good place to stay. The rooms were spacious. Enough storage space for clothing and luggage. Nice pool area and well maintained outside activities. I felt as though the outside of the building looked "dated". But the inside decode was fine. No problem with the WiFi system. You do have to drive to get to anything that you would want to do in town. Walking down to the beach is a hike, but doable. I definitely recommend this hotel for a nice stay.

Check-in was good, was even given 3 choices of room locations. The facility had some nice things on property that could help pass the time for families staying multiple nights. The room was dated and dark. TV's were small for the rooms and poorly mounted. Bed was tolerable. For the price it wasn't that bad of a place to stay. The highlight was breakfast at Adele's in the lobby-breakfast burrito was delicious!

Checking into the San Clemente Inn was a breeze.  They had our info and we were given our room keys.  I did ask if they might have a two bedroom avail.  but they did not, the hotel was packed.  We put our belongings away  and relaxed.  I was disappointed with the furniture and the all around look of the room.  The lady at the desk had told me that it was a recently remodeled room.   I have yet to figure out what was remodled?  The counch and chair looked old and had spots on them,  the tables were  at best maybe refinished.  My daughter and her husband took the bedroom and my 18 yr. old grandson took the Murphy Beds in the  dining room area.  I was expecting a sleeper sofa mattress, but that was not the case.  Real mattresses and comfort.  The A/C worked very well.   The kitchen

We had lovely stay at San Clemente Inn - really close to nice and family beach, a perfect place to relax.  Room are very comfortable, spacious, clean that feel s like home. Service is wonderful!  Location its the best, close to the beach and city centre where you can find great restaurants.  The beach walk to the wharf its a must.  We will be back soon

The San Clemente Inn is a great retro blast from the past hotel. The location is three blocks from the beach and the rooms well maintained .  It would be a perfect spot for families  with young kids wanting a fun get- away.  Putt- putt golf, ping pong tables, kids pool and safe areas to run around bring a welcome invitation to other areas of Orange County.  The staff could not be nicer.

While on a trip to Southern California, we were unexpectedly seeking accommodations in San Clemente. Our stay at San Clemente Inn, was warm, welcoming and extended due to a wonderful lady at the front desk making us feel at home. The facility is excellent for the family (mini golf, shuffle board, pools, spas, lounge, movies for children, pool tables..... should I continue?) Anyway the stay was so welcoming and comfortable we will return many times in the future. Great rooms, cozy and clean. What a great stay.

The Inn is a bit dated as other reviews have mentioned but the staff is friendly and will accommodate you as best as they can.  Lots of basic activities for the kids at the resort to keep them occupied if you wish to stay there vs traveling the area.  We spent most of our time visiting the coastal area and the surf towns and were satisfied coming back to the Inn for a night's rest before heading out again the next day.   Beach is close by, lots of parking if you drive or a 20-30 min walk each way (all uphill on the way back).  We used it as a timeshare exchange.  Not sure if we would pay the asking rate per night but you may not have cheaper options as that appears to be the going rate for the area.  Overall a happy trip for the family.

This hotel was so-so as far as location- it was semi-close to the beach, which is quite the hike or $15 for a day parking access near it. We felt like while the pool and fun family amenities were nice the hotel is dated and the finishes are tired. Nothing is really close so we had to drive everywhere. Staff was nice, not overly, but nice. Room was clean, but the fluorescent lighting made it gloomy and dark so we never hung around. The grounds were pretty well maintained as well. We probably wouldn't stay again.

My first time in San Clemente, nice location, nice town. Check in is slow but organized well, room is decent sized 1 bedroom with kitchenette beach is 10 min hike down hill park at the inn, it's free and available the beach lot is bust and you gotta pay. Free wifi is slow, I'm updating this on cell service.

Nice location, wonderful kids area, close to beach. 60 miles from San Diego. Rooms are outdated but clean. Nice staff. There is a restaurant on grounds. Food is good, only open for breakfast and lunch except  for Fri and Sat

Summary Heading: A Motel 6 with a few add-ons
Summary: San Clemente is a great little spot to base yourself if visiting Legoland. A town with character and a great beach. Shame then that this place is an over-priced "resort." It has a bunch of things to keep kids happy - pool, mini-golf etc. But it is seriously dated and tired. The decor in the room is dreadful and worn. If we had paid $100-125/night we'd have accepted as reasonable value for a 2-3 star motel. At $185/night they were simply price gouging - presumably because it was school holidays and/or it was sufficiently close to Legoland. Instead of spending the extra monday, stay in the heart of San Clemente for less and save the money for Legoland or spend it at the good restaurants in the town.

This place is really nice.  Plenty of activities for the family, such as miniature golf, shuffle board, badminton, basketball, tennis, ping pong, billiards, air hockey, and bingo.  There is an exercise room, some of the equipment is old, but it all still works fine, the treadmill looked pretty new.  You can rent movies from the front desk, all are included in your stay.  The resort is close to shopping, the beach, and plenty of restaurants.  I read reviews and looked at photos before I booked.  The majority of the reviews were good, some not so good.  The photos do not do the place justice.  It is much better in person.  All of the employees that we had contact with were great.  The place was clean.  You won't get bored at this resort.  Lots of families here.  We enjoyed this

Summary Heading: Good Hotel with plenty of ammenities
Summary: If you are traveling with family and kids, this is your place. It is a bit warned down, but has all the fun-summer Californian entertaiment you need: pools, mini golf, games, hiking-bike trails, and more.  Our suite was huge for the 2 of us: private room, 2 bathrooms, living room, kitchenette, dinning area and a nice balcony with a view.  It had a wall-hidden full size bed, and a sofa bed, so you can easily accommodate 6 people.  It is locate at short distance drive from the beach and down town San Clemente.  We got a Groupon deal for $89/night, and it was great!

The suite was beautiful & very comfortable. The view from our balcony was beautiful. You could hear the waves. Great location. Not far from the beach & restaurants. We had such a great time. Will definitely come back!

The room did not look like the picture, it was outdated and it looked like it had not been upgraded since I was there in 1979.  The room was not inviting or romantic.  I know the maids cleaned it, but it still felt dirty.  It smelled like someone poured a gallon  of Clorox in there.  The bedding was old and outdated.  It was just horrible!  We requested an early check in over a month ago and you would think that they would try to get us in before the check in time 4:00, after all we checked in at 1:00 in hopes that they would honor our request.  We could not wait to leave the hotel (we left after 6am the next day)!  So happy to be home, the only reason we stayed there was to drop off our grandchildren after a long visit and that I used to work there long ago and I remembered how

Summary Heading: Terrific holiday value -- easy to park, stay and play!
Summary: This place was perfect for a busy holiday weekend. Depending on your room choice, it property is ideal for a family or a romantic break away... Speaking of breakers, we chose a junior suite -- which featured a the large deck, overlooking parklike wooded grounds, and partial view of the Pacific breaking rocks. As for the suite -- spacious is an understatement.  The suite included a separate bedroom, with door to bath,  vast living room, with a secret set of murphy beds -- nicely designed into panel wall. And of course there was a complete kitchenette, with dishwasher, and a fine dining area. Nor was the rates excessive -- very reasonable compared to downtown San Clemente -- only a few minutes away. And a stroll to the ocean, is again a matter of minutes. There is plenty to do
Manager Response: Mike,  We are happy to hear your family enjoyed their stay with the San Clemente Inn! Next time your family visits the area, we hope you will again consider staying with us during your travels. Thank you for taking the time to support the Inn through the review process.

Summary: We booked three rooms two months a head of time and call to let them know we would like to have all three rooms next to each other. We where told that we had to wait until we arrived and there where no guarantees. When we did arrive at 2pm so we could try to get the room next to each other we where told it wasn't possible and all three rooms where sprees out. On top of that we where told to come back at 4pm and our rooms would be ready. So we killed to hours at the beach and came back to check in and we where told the rooms still where not ready. We didn't get our rooms until 5:30pm and then the rooms where not as advertised our tv for the living room was in the kitchen the Murphy beds where in the dinning room and we had to move the table to put them down. The bed room door was
Manager Response: David,  I am sorry to hear that your stay with us was not what you had hoped for or envisioned and that you felt the rooms were not represented properly. I am also very sorry to hear that you were not offered a speedy check in. Checking in at 5:30pm is completely unacceptable. Management has followed up with staff regarding your experience.   We hope you offer the San Clemente Inn another chance to serve you in the future. Please feel free to reach out to management if you would like to further discuss your stay with us.

Summary: We traded our timeshare in Sedona to go here as a third week of beach vacation. After reading some of the reviews, I was concerned that the property would be dumpy but was pleasantly surprised. The grounds are well kept and the rooms were furnished fine.  We stayed in a unit that sleeps six with 1.5 baths and kitchenette. With just the two of us, it was great space to spread out. Love the separate bathrooms. Bed was average queen in the master.   The staff was friendly and helpful. Hair dryer blew up and a maintenance guy appeared quickly with a new one.  Also appreciated the daily maid service. On vacation, who wants to make the bed?  While there is no elevator on this three-story property, the second floor is ground level. So you only have to go up or down one flight of
Manager Response: Vicki,  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with the San Clemente Inn. Our staff is dedicated to offering our guest a memorable experience and it seems as if you had one. We hope to see you and your family again in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and close to the beach
Summary: I had come to this hotel twice. I'm pretty satisfied with their service and cleanness.  They location is close to beach, 10 minutes walk, and close to freeway.  Very nice and quiet environment.  They have a lot of facilities, like free DVD, free tennis court.  Thank you for the service.
Manager Response: Management is pleased to hear your experience was a great one! We look forward to your next visit to San Clemente, and hope you will stay again with us during your travels. Cheers!

Summary Heading: Customer Service training for front desk is needed!
Summary: The front desk staff Suzanne was extremely rude. This being my first time here she not helpful at all with the check in procedures- Hard to understand her between her gum snapping and arm crossed stance, she continued to tell me to see if my name was on "the round table" which it was but never explained to me what that meant, Once she knew I booked this room through Booking.com all she did was complain about them and that I should call them if I didn't get the room I wanted. Which wasn't the case yet because at this point I didn't even see the room. She continued to ask me if I knew this was a holiday week end and they are busy.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are so sorry to hear that you felt the staff was unaccommodating. Management will follow up with the staff member in question regarding your statements. Although holiday weekends at the resort can be hectic, we never want our guests feeling unsure or as if they are not being taken care of with the upmost concern. Please feel free to reach out to management at 949-492-6103 to discuss your experience further. We hope you will offer the San Clemente Inn another chance in the future to serve you.

Summary: The San Clemente Inn is, for lack of a nicer word, disgusting. I could not stay there. I traveled from San Diego for a long-needed away-from-home but close enough to drive vacation. The rooms smell, the furniture is so uninviting I was afraid to sit on the couch, it did not seem safe. It was not near anything (but the freeway.) One of the reasons I thought it would be a good getaway was because it had a restaurant. The restaurant was closed (or certainly didn't appear to be open) when we went to check in today, but from the looks of the outside I would not want to eat there. Although they claim the rooms were recently renovated, it has a bad 1970s old and decrepit look, with painted cabinets, and everything was a very old brown. Although I was aware that there was no air
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to respond. We are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay at the San Clemente Inn. We only wish that you had taken a moment to speak directly with a manager regarding your issues with the resort.  To discuss further your complaints, the San Clemente Inn is directly off the 5 freeway, approximately three blocks from the ocean. Although some of our units have partial ocean views, we do not consider the resort an ocean view property. The restaurant, Adele's, is open daily although she only serves breakfast and lunch Sunday through Thursday, and reopens at 5pm on Fridays and Saturdays for dinner. All of our units have been renovated in phases. The color scheme does appear in the units to have an earthly feel and the kitchen cabinets do have laminate over them. Lastly, we do have a 10am check out time as you stated; however, we offer our guests the ability to check in as early as 1pm if a unit is clean and available. Although this is an earlier check out time, we do offer late check outs to our guests. This is offered on a first call, first serve basis and the amount of late check outs we extend to our guests depends on the amount of check-ins/check-outs we have for that day.  Again, we are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with the San Clemente Inn. Management would be happy to discuss any of the above issues with you. Please feel free to reach out to our team at 949-492-6103.

Summary: We stayed in a studio room. For the price it was a little overpriced. The kitchen was nice and everything worked and utensils were there, bathroom big, but they could have made other things a little nicer. The shower splattered all over the floor because there was no tub and just a curtain. The tile looked gross.  There is free miniature golfing, which was ok.  Probably wouldn't stay here again because there are nicer places around for a good price. Good for a one time stay.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your stay was "ok" and not "fantastic". In the future, if you stay with the San Clemente Inn again, please ask to speak with management over any concerns you may have. We never want any of our guests leaving the property who are not 100% satisfied with our services.   The resort does not offer bath tubs on the property, only showers. In regards, to the shower curtain, it appears you may have been in one of our ADA compliant units, as it was the only available unit left for the evening. All other units offer shower glass doors, which would protect the floor from any water traveling. Our ADA units cannot offer this as the shower must be wheelchair assessable. In addition, I will follow up with our housekeeping staff, including the supervisor and room inspector regarding your comments over the tile.    Thank you for your candor, and we hope you will offer the San Clemente Inn another chance to serve you. If you would like to further discuss your stay, please do not hesitate to contact one of our management team members.

Summary: We traded in to this for a spring vacation.  This is a very old motel that has been turned into a time share.  It is not a destination resort but a good place to hang your hat a night to sleep.  The restaurant is actually pretty good and the pool area nice.  They need to convert the barbecues to gas and improve the wifi system.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. It is no secret that the San Clemente Inn is an older property. That said, we work very hard to not only maintain the current grounds, but are consistently undergoing projects that upgrade the property through our renovation efforts. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed are pool area and other amenities. The San Clemente Inn offers many amenities that cannot be found at other properties in the area.  In response to your comments regarding the WIFI, we have just completed a full upgrade of our network system here at the San Clemente Inn. The installation of this new equipment has been a tremendous upgrade to the property. We hope this new system will remind our guests that the management team truly listens to all of our guest's comments, suggestions, and concerns to continuously improve the resort. In addition, I will follow up with our Board of Directors on your comments regarding the BBQ's.  Thank you again for your review. We hope that you will consider the San Clemente Inn once again in the future.

Summary Heading: I want to move to san Clemente
Summary: Clean. Nice kitchenette. Clean, large pool. Jacuzzi for adults. Bar. Restaurant. Less than 5 minutes from beach. Beach is quaint. Exercise friendly. Lots of surfing. Perfect for camp Pendleton families...the base is 5 minutes down the street. (10 with traffic) Very nice place. Felt safe. Only negatives: no coat hangars, small hanging closet. There is a busy street in front and the beach has an active, weekend train, but didn't bother me. I was parking lot/ street side..
Manager Response: San Clemente is a great place to visit and an even better place to live! Although it is not a worldwide known destination spot, those travelers fortunate to find this hidden gem often return for future visits. Management is pleased to know that San Clemente was a great fit for you and your family and that you enjoyed your stay at the San Clemente Inn. We also serve many military families, similar to yours, who are visiting their relatives who are stationed at Camp Pendleton.   In response to your comments regarding the coat hangers, we do offer these in each unit. I will follow up with our Executive Housekeeper to let her know, that this was overlooked in your room.   Thank you so much for your review and we hope to serve you again in the future.

Summary: We get checked in quickly and efficiently.  We request an upper level unit and they give us room 360 on the third floor.  We‚Äôre overlooking the mini-golf, shuffleboard, barbecue and grass area.  The swimming pool is off to the west of us and far enough away that we don‚Äôt get any of the noise  The condo is a one bedroom (queen bed) unit with 1 ¬Ω baths, something we haven‚Äôt encountered before.  They do have a nice size stall shower.  The unit also has two Murphy beds and a sofa bed.  That would be one crowded condo with six people in it.  The flat screen TV in the living room is relatively small and the unit in the bedroom is really small.  They are, however, adequate.  The mini-kitchen has very limited counter space with a two-burner electric stove, microwave, dishwasher, fridge
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the San Clemente Inn. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay. The Inn has been a staple in San Clemente for many years and although the buildings themselves are older, we take great pride in maintaining the grounds and units. Again, we are happy to know the staff was efficient and friendly and that your stay was enjoyable. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: This place was cute.  I like the queen bed and the two Murphy beds. I only had one problem checking in with Groupon.  We didn't know we had to redeem it for the office to receive our reservation.  That was resolved fairly quickly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We are sorry to hear that there may have been an issue with your check-in, but are glad to know this issue was resolved promptly. We hope to see you and your family again in the future.

Summary: This is a great place to stay if your going to San Clemente. The staff is great and the service is excellent. This hotel is also close to just about everything you would want to do down there with easy access to freeways and tourist destinations. We had a great time!!!
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with the San Clemente Inn. The resort strives to provide our guests with the best possible customer service and experience that we can. We hope to serve you again during your future travels. Cheers!

Summary: We got a groupon, and when you get a groupon you take a chance. Either the place is desperate to stay in business, or a new owner took over and wants your business. I would not call it a resort, except for the playful amenities, but for anything else it lacked the resort feeling. Though this is supposed to be family friendly, diaper aged children are not allowed in the pool and have no where to play (playground), just some fake grass in hope they do not get hip with a mini golf ball. The rooms are decent size but very old furniture, although the murphy beds were comfortable, and the kitchen equipment is better than other places I have stayed in. The bathroom was another story, could have been refurbished a little better so as not to look to old and worn out. They stack towels in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. I regret to hear that your stay was not all you had hoped it would be. However, we appreciate your honesty as your comments will help to improve the resort.   In response to your comments regarding housekeeping... We do offer a daily housekeeping service free of charge. This service includes vacuuming, replenishing all of the supplies including towels, making the beds, etc. I will follow up with our Executive Housekeeper to make her aware that we had a guest who did not receive their service. In addition, although diaper age children are not allowed in the swimming pool, the current renovation plans for the resort do include the installation of a children's pool. This work should begin some time in 2016.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you incurred during your stay. We hope you will give us the opportunity to serve you again in the future. If you would like to reach out to management regarding any other issues please contact the resort at 949-492-6103.

Summary: We are owners at the San Clemente Inn and decided to take advantage of one of their owners specials.  The Crest Unit, which is the largest unit ended up costing us $69 a night for 3 nights.  We were there in May of last year and I was amazed at all the improvements that had been made. They have a very nice little 9 hole miniature golf, shuffle board, a couple new sitting areas and the place is still a work in progress. We ate at Adeles which is their restaurant and everything was excellent! The food, the service and the atmosphere were all excellent.  In all the years we have gone there we have never been disappointed.  As always our grandkids had a great time on the grounds. Definitely a hidden, affordable treasure on the Southern California coast!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. It is always a pleasure serving our Owner's on other occasions besides their annual use week. The staff works hard to give back to our loyal Owners and repeat guests by providing awesome staycation promotional rates during our off season. We look forward to your next stay with us and appreciate you taking the time to let us know how we are doing!   Management

Summary: Plenty of on site activities mixed with the beach made for an enjoyable vacation.  Room very clean and staff exceptionally accommodating.  A definite return for our family. The rooms are affordable.   When upgrades are complete a family won't want to pass this up.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review and your support for the resort. The staff at San Clemente Inn is delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay! We too are excited for the upcoming changes our property faces over the next couple years. We believe it will greatly enhance all of our guest's enjoyment of the property.   We hope to see you back real soon.  Management

Summary Heading: Home away from home at very economical rates.
Summary: Stayed over the Easter weekend in a 6  seater suite. Cozy and comact suite facing the sea at the back. Quite and with a learge balcony with coffee table and four chairs. Private queen bedroom for privacy and   four beds in the main living room. Two were Murphy beds and two were convertible sofa bed  which was good for teenage children. Fully stocked kitchen with cooking utensils, wine and juice glasses, full size refrigerator, a dishwasher, full size microwave  and a twin stove top. You cannot ask for more.All for just $110  a night !! A beautifull beach just a short 10 min walk on the backside  with a glorious sunset. Many boutique shops and restaurants only 5 mins drive by car and the pier  which was beautiful, clean and scenic. Will definately go back again for another
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear your Spring Break experience exceeded your expectations. The resort does offer great discounted rates throughout the off season in appreciation for our loyal guests. We hope this becomes a tradition for your family and that you revisit the resort in the near future. Thanks again for all your kind words!  Management

Summary Heading: Good affordable property close to both food and attractions.
Summary: The rooms are above the parking area so they are somewhat remored from street noise.  The rooms include a "sitting area" and a sleeping area in addition to the vanity area.  There is plenty of natural light and ventillation from the windows at both ends of the rooms (courtyard on one side and either street or alley on other). The furnishings are not fancy, but functional.  Plenty of room to deal with kids if they are along.  There are agreements with local food establishments for discounts.  Not fancy, but functional.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review regarding your recent stay with us. We are happy to hear the accommodations worked well for you and your family. Although we do not consider ourselves a Montage or Ritz Carlton, we do feel we offer a quality experience with a family friendly atmosphere. Additionally, you can count on our staff to provide exceptional customer service to each of our guests and will find them knowledgeable about local events and activities.   We hope to see you and your family in the near future.  Management

Summary Heading: Best kept secret in San Clemente
Summary: I've stayed at the San Clemente Inn a few times and my stay has always been more than pleasant. The rooms are clean, the staff is extremely friendly and will go out of their way to make you happy. The golf course is a wonderful addition to the property as my friends kids couldn't get enough of it. The food is fantastic and I can't wait to visit again. Thanks San Clemente Inn for another wonderful experience!!

I just stayed at the San Clemente Inn for a second time. We went last spring break and had such a great time that we decided to go back this year. The staff was just as friendly as I remembered and always provided the best recommendations for dinner and things to do. We booked the smaller one bedroom suite, which was still very spacious and included a kitchenette. The room itself was very clean. The grounds were well maintained and the restaurant on site offered a great breakfast. I would definitely return again. I have stayed at several other hotels in the local area, and none of them have the amount of amenities that this hotel has and their location cannot be beat.

We booked a few days here through Groupon.  While this is definitely an older hotel undergoing renovations, our unit was clean and spacious.  The room overlooked the mini golf course and shuffleboard area.  The queen size bed was not the most comfortable bed I ever slept in, but it was fine for the few nights were were there.  Murphy beds were perfect for kids.  Only downside to this hotel is the distance from "town" and they do not provide any shuttle service.  We were able to walk to the beach...but it is an uphill walk coming back. The older woman at the front desk gave us wrong directions twice, so we opted not to ask anymore. We had breakfast at Adele's the morning we check out.  There were only two other tables occupied when we arrived and it took almost a half hour to get

Summary Heading: The Days Inn of Vacation Resorts
Summary: Older property.  While listing states that it was "Recently Renovated," property is tired and stills needs updating.  Staff seem overworked and undertrained. Not a very happy team. Desk clerk directed us to the next town (Dana Point) for restaurants even though San Clemente has a wide variety of good and creative eateries.  Hotel caters to surfers, one nighters and large families. Restaurant only open on weekends. Signage, info sheets and directories for area either hand written, amateurish or incomplete--i.e. no addresses given for restaurants. Awakened by fireworks in pool area at Midnight.  Staff did not investigate but was told by manager that staff wrote in logbook that they heard "gunshots."  Would think that might prompt a call to police or at least investigate. DVD only

It's walking distance, downhill on Califia Street, to a nice sandy beach where there is also a great Burger place. Or take the walking trail along the railroad tracks to the pier.  Btw, Do not eat at Adele's. Bloody Mary was nothing but ice cubes and spray of v-8 juice. For breakfast, the food was possible heated in a microwave since the biscuits and gravy had very little inner heat. Oh, and the food is horribly overcharged for what you get.

This is not an impressive or exceptional resort. It's dated and feels dated. But the units are clean and the staff is pleasant and helpful. It feels like this property was built in the early 60's. The decor and floor plans are not that impressive but they work if you are not fussy about those things. They have a pool, a few holes of minature golf and tennis courts. The biggest asset of the resort is it's location.It's a short walk to the beach. That's it's saving grace. If it didn't have that feature, I probably would not have stayed here. The property also has a restaurant on site but it was not open when I stayed there. I stay in timeshares all along the coast. This one is probably the least impressive of those but if you are not looking for a more upscale experience, you will

OMG is this place old.  It said it was renovated - HAH!    The beds were horrible - very hard and old.  It was also extremely noisy.  Check-in was not convenient at all.  We called and they told us our room would be ready for an early arrival.  We got there, and they said it would still be 2-3 hours.  The printer did not work at the business area.  There was no exercise facilities.

We will come back again and again.  CLEAN and spacious rooms, comfortable beds (firm), easy check in, friendly and helpful staff...the positive things I have to say about the San Clemente Inn go on and on.  It is geared towards family with so many things to do onsite.  The location is perfect for sight seeing and doing tourist stuff (the beach is walking distance!) and then we come back for the evening and swim, mini golf, play pool, grill, and just enjoy being outside.  I love that the kitchens in the room are actual size and actually useable.  So often a "kitchenette" in hotels is a travel fridge and microwave.  Not here.  The fridge is large enough to stock for the week, plenty of dishes, a stove top, microwave - even a dishwasher!  They even supply dish soap.  We saved a

Summary Heading: Serves it's Purpose Yet Nothing Special
Summary: This is the second time I have stayed here. The first time it was the hottest day of the year and they had the pool closed. This time, the restaurant was closed for evening meal. I either have bad timing or they can't make everything work well at once. I'm not sure which it is. The unit was fine. It was clean, well stocked and comfortable, but very dated. The kitchen, dining area and living room are all one room, which is not my favored arrangement.  If you stay here, I suggest staying on the third floor and facing the state park. It's generally quieter.  The entire back space behind the buildings is artificial turf, which I personally find less desirable than real grass. If you don't mind poor taste in design, landscaping and a blue collar feel to the property then you should

Summary Heading: Great buy through Living Social, we would definitely come back!
Summary: We really liked it here. There is so much to do with the activities that we wished we had 4 nights. We thought the staff was very efficient and helpful. They helped find us a room with a pretty view and though it wasn't ready we were ok with that and were able to play foosball and air hockey. They did say they would call us when the room was ready but we went to the desk at 4, and they hadn't called yet but the room was ready right then, so not that big of a deal. So here's what you need to know... There is a Ralph's grocery VERY close by. (1.4 miles). The BBQ's take charcoal only, and we got free matches at the 7-11 back to the hotel. The DVD selection is pretty current. If you are planning on cooking bring at least one sharp knife, a lot of non stick spray, oil, butter or even

We stayed here for 8 nights. The hotel is very clean. Pool area spotless. Mini golf was right outside our balcony which was great.  Our room had all the cooking utensils, pots, cutlery you would need. They even supply dish washer tablets and washing up liquid. Reception staff were very helpful especially Susan who even noticed I had got a tan! If we're ever back in San Clemente I will definitely stay here.

We stayed a week while visiting friends. It was a very convenient place for an extended stay.  The hotel restaurant/bar serves good eats. There is a live band at night.  The beach is 5 minutes away.  The location just off the highway is very accessible yet set far enouph back to be very quiet.

Enjoyed our stay. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Grounds are very well maintained.  It is a little dated in appearance,  but everything was neat and clean. Nice pool area and 2 hot tubs. One for adults only. We would stay here again without question.

We had the large suite. Very nice, a little dated but large and comfy! 2 bathrooms were a plus. Kitchen had all we needed. Loved sitting out on the patio in the sunshine too!  I would stay here again! They do have mini golf, shuffle board, a pool, jacuzzi and tennis courts too! Walk down the hill to the beach or take the beautiful trails all the way to the pier. We Love Walking Along Below the Cliffs And Next To the ocean.

We booked on Hotel tonight and got an excellent price (72/night with tax). The room was huge with all the amenities of a small apartment! The facilities were very nice even though the gym was dated and only had one treadmill. Luckily a remodel is in store (maybe done this year?) and everything is due to be updated. Would recommend for a family or couple who want a hotel that includes an apartment feel.

My boyfriend and I currently stayed here, it was very clean and very nice it blew our expections out of the water, the rooms are very large and spacious, this will be the hotel we stay at when we come into town.

We love staying in the San Clemente Inn. It has everything. Microwave, fridge, coffee pot, toaster, two burner hot plate and this is in the studio. We also love the surroundings, great pool and Jacuzzi. Also has grills and shuffleboard as well as miniature golf. Close to the beach and restaurants and only a mile from the center of town.

First room we were in had a terrible ant problem. All of our food had to be tossed. Confusion over how to handle our loss. We understood they would replace our food. Then later, even though maintenance saw all the ants and sprayed, they would not give us the food they bought because we didn't carry the ants to them for pictures!  Second room was ok, but furniture very old and uncomfortable. Layout of both rooms very poor. In order to watch the tiny tv in living room, we had to sit at a kitchen table with uncomfortable chairs. The first room we actually moved the furniture around so we could sit on the sofa in front of tv.

Jr. Suite was spacious and clean.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  This room was a handicap room.  The shower was huge.  My husband I loved our stay.  The restaurant was also really yummy.  We had the lobster omelet

We stayed at the San Clemente Inn for four nights and have already planned our next visit!  Conveniently located, well sized rooms, clean and quiet.   The suites have a kitchenette which makes it very convenient for making morning coffee and a quick bite to eat.  I've stayed at other San Clemente places and this compares favorably.  Ask for a room on the ground floor so you won't have to carry your luggage up the stairs.  Otherwise, take it easy and enjoy being by the beach!

We chose the Crest suite for the 6 of us. the room was decent, comfy beds and clean. having 1 1/2 bath was just the order for the 4 kids.. the pool and updated play ground was added bonus as well as keeping the kids busy. a walking distance to the beach.. easy getting on off the freeway. San Clemente was such a cool little town with small town atmosphere.. this is the second time that we stayed here in San Clemente and enjoyed a whole lot.. will be back.

Summary Heading: I DON'T WANT TO BE UNFAIR - BUT!
Summary: The brochure makes this resort appear to be a first class beach property. It isn't. For me the lack of elevator [lug your bags etc up the stairs], very uncomfortable bed, minimal furnishings from the 80's, and musky, dim appearance made this at best 2-star property. It is extremely dated [1980's] in appearance and seriously uncomfortable furnishings, If I were in a National Park, this would be a great cottage or cabin, but for a somewhat famous resort, it falls short for me. The hotel has a storied background from luxury Hollywood hangout, to flop-house, to now a timeshare property which is trying to make upgrades to service [this they have done, nice staff, very helpful], and to the property [minimal upgrades like safety bars] but not enough to make a difference to what is

We stayed here because it was minutes from the beach. On the night we got in, we drove the short drive to the beach but there were railroad tracks right on the sand. There were hardly any cars (didn‚Äôt look like it was a busy type of beach) but you still had to pay for parking and you had to do a minimum of 2 hours. We didn‚Äôt stay or go back the next day. Maybe if we walked around we would have seen an amazing beach. Don‚Äôt know. The railroad tracks blew it for us. Instead we got up early and drove about 40 minutes to Newport Beach, which we knew we loved.  The room was clean and had a regular size fridge, small stove and a microwave. The A/C didn‚Äôt work well but we didn‚Äôt report it. The evenings were cool enough with the windows open. Even if the A/C worked well, it wouldn‚Äôt do

Summary Heading: Great staff & location, nice property brought done by poor mgr policies
Summary: The staff at the hotel are warm and welcoming and do their best to make their guests comfortable.  Only one problem -- "the board" and "the management" makes a weekend jaunt inconvenient.  Policy is can't check in to hotel before 1pm even when hotel not sold out so must come back to front desk at 1pm to verfiy check in.  Makes no sense and for a 36 hour quick getaway very inconvenient.  Also, check out is 10 am.  So forget sleeping.  On the positive side, the staff is very generous and kind.  The property is fine as are the accomodations.  The Saturday night show at Adele's is not to be missed - a lot of fun.  If their board would change their unusual policies this would be a gem of a quick getaway weekend any time of year.

Summary Heading: Ideal location for a get away
Summary: Welcoming place to stay with partial kitchens, lots of dish ware, beach, miniature golf , ping pong, food ball, separate hot tub for children and another for adults.  Entertainment and restaurant on site.  Take long walks on a pathway to the San Clemente Pier or lounge in open spaces with a fountain, and goegeous views from the second floor.  Balconies allow you to bask in the sun.  A great getaway for all.

Stayed in a studio here for three nights in late October; couldn't be happier.  Room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable, with upscale furnishings and many thoughtful amenities.  Studio included queen size bed, small kitchenette with two-burner stove and microwave, full-size refrigerator, dishes, paper towels, coffee maker, ice machine (on site), hair dryer, ironing board, air conditioning unit, and many other amenities.  Room has chairs, dresser, square dining table, patio with outdoor chairs, and more.  Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They even mailed me some belongings I left behind.  Although the 5 Freeway is a short distance away, the place is well-built enough that you don't hear it with your door closed.  Inn is located on the ocean side of the highway;

If you are looking for a 4 or 5 star place this is not it. If you are looking for location to the beach, not pricey and lots of amenities you've hit the jackpot!!! Great kitchenette, fully stocked with just about everything you might need. Each room has a balcony which is sweet. Has a great little restaurant for breakfast. Owner is fantastic! Just a short walk to the beach then 1 1/4 mile walk to the pier.   The hotel is old, that's why not the 4 or 5 star but I really enjoyed it. Pick rooms away from the freeway and not a ground floor as I was a family of raccoons and smelled skunk.  Having a view is really great. That was a room I had. (See photo)  My first time here and I'll come back.

We just stayed at the San Clemente Inn last weekend.  I cannot say enough about the location, helpfulness and friendliness of the staff and value for the reservation.  The rooms were very nice with full-sized refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers and a 2 burner cook top.  We didn't get to use the putt putt golf, shuffle board or pool, but they all looked wonderful.  The place was clean and updated.  We are hoping our friends plan another vacation so we can stay there again!

This was a great little find that was a spur of the moment thing.  We were heading back to LA County Saturday afternoon from San Marcos, but when passing through Camp Pendleton wondered if there was any nearby cheap hotels to enjoy the area just a little bit longer. I whip out the handy dandy Hotel Tonight App (famous for heavily discounting last minute bookings) and found this gem of a hotel.  It was the lowest priced that Saturday night for $90.  We were a little hesitant because check in isn't til 4pm and check OUT was a bit early at 10am.  It was kinda unexpected, and since we weren't looking to stay too late on Sunday, it worked for us.  So as my buddy drives, I book.  Wham, Bam, Shazam....we got a room way last minute.  Like really, maybe an hour or so before check in.

Summary Heading: First trip to San Clemente, California
Summary: This is actually also an RCI exchange location and that is how we made our reservations.  Nice grounds and free 9 hole challenging mini golf, shuffleboard, etc.  Has both an adult and children's hot tub, which we have not seen before.  Nice Monday info meeting with coffee, juice and donuts,  Most activities are for kids.  Lobby was beautifully decorated for Halloween.    Area has lots to do and nice beaches.  They even have free DVD's.  Staff was responsive to our needs.  We were on the ground floor though and our one bedroom unit was musty smelling and room spray and candles did not make it go away and doors were tight.  Plus, one of the burners on our stove stopped working,That is our only negative.

So nice to actually experience all the newness of this hotel's recent update. Reading the prior reviews we were a bit skeptical but upon checking into our room there was new furniture, new carpet and paint the room was very clean and tidy. Loved the pull-down Murphy beds, I cannot say enough about how comfortable they were. The queen size bed in the bedroom appeared to be new as well and was a very comfy sleep. There are two entrances to the one bathroom so you can come and go without disturbing anyone in the main bedroom, definitely a plus.  There is no oven in the kitchen but a nice large microwave, fridge and hot plate are enough to cook a meal in. The coffee maker worked very well too. There are so many on-site activities for adults and children as well as a restaurant if

I book at least a week yearly as a home base to go to The Pageant of the Masters in Laguna Beach. It's a great location just off the freeway and a short drive to the other Beach Cities. The staff is friendly and eager to help in any way needed. The units have been remodeled and the rear pool area has been upgraded with a couple gazebos, miniature golf, hot tubs, grills, artificial  turf and a white picket fence separating the property from the woods.

Spent a nice week at the San Clemente Inn, read other reviews and wasn't sure what to expect.  This was an exchange week with VRI & RCI.  Our room was very nice, a little outdated but not as bad as others have said. Very close to the beach, pier wasn't too far and lots of restaurants and bars. On sit restaurant was only open til 3pm and only Fri. & Sat. nights for dinner.  Only had one lunch there and was OK.

My husband and I stayed at the San Clemente Inn as we had a wedding to attend in San Clemente. What a delightful little place this is! It backs up to the San Clemente State Park so it's a nice little walk to the beach from there. They have a nice pool, a mini golf course, a tennis court and a great restaurant called "Adele's". The rooms are spacious with a little kitchen and a great deal for the money! This would be a fun place for a girls get-away and I hope to do it soon!

Stayed here for the Hurley Pro Surf competition. Great location, spacious rooms. to get a Jr suite for the money was outstanding The service was excellent, pool, tennis court, really enjoyed it. Were starting our drive from San Diego to Napa Valley. This is the second stop and happy to say not dissapointed at all. Next stop Carmel/Monterey

Great spot if you are on a surf trip. It is very close to some of California's great surf spots. Rooms were outdated and you are able to hear the neighbors through the walls. It definitely felt more like a motel experience.  The hotel or 'motel' does have rooms with pull out bed options and full kitchens. After traveling for a week it was nice to be able to cook your own breakfast. It was ok. Nothing special and I think you could find better but it wasn't horrible either.

We arrived early and were able to check in. We got a room with a garden view. The rooms have been remodeled and are very nice.  We only stayed one night so we didn't take advantage of the kitchenette but appreciated the fridge for our leftovers.  The grounds were well maintained and twilight mini golf was fun with my daughter. Too bad the poolside bar wasn't open - a glass of wine would have been nice.  It's close to the State Beach and downtown.  I would recommend to anyone looking for a good value.

RCI rep. recommended this and it was challenging!  Room not remodeled in years and dirty, activities taught by people who learned yoga and water aerobics on UTube they said, restaurant with "adult entertainment" not even fit for adults (with loads of kids around) and bad food.  Worst of all were the skunks every night!!!  We traded a great 3 bedroom in Scottsdale for this tiny one bedroom!!!

I truly enjoyed my stay at the San Clemente Inn Resort.  They have newly remodeled their rooms.  Very nice!  The staff was extremely helpful and polite.  Will come back again & again.  Lovely resort with great staff.

Summary Heading: Donnie and Valerie from Santa Maria disappointed
Summary: We've stayed here once before. The only reason that we stayed here again is that we didn't have many choices offered to us from our exchange company. In other words, if my wife and I want a studio, it's either here or Winner's Circle. When we checked in on Sunday, we were assigned a room over the parking lot a stone's throw from the highway. Our toilet and bathroom were filthy. We had maintenance clean and sanitize the toilet which was obviously neglected by "room service." Theodore, from maintenance, zealously noted how soiled the conditions in our bathroom were and promptly and zealously cleaned it to our satisfaction. Also, the dvd player was faulty as well as us having nosy, intruding neighbors who constantly leered at us through our back sliding door window. Front desk

I recently stayed here for only one night. The room was decent but I will say that the Hotel is older and needs upgrades. My main issue with the people that work here is the lack of communication or effort where it comes to customer service. The checkout time is 10 am and I accidentally left my cosmetic bag in the bathroom rushing to leave. Unfortunately I didn't realize I had done this until I was all the way back in Los Angeles. It took three days to verify that the bag was there because the housekeeping manager was not available. Apparently no one at the front desk can verify left behind items until the housekeeping manager makes them aware. When she called me back I mentioned that my daughter thought she left a charge and she said "Well I cant go in the room while someones

In theory the San Clemente Inn has a lot going for it.  It has a great location; it is only a nine minute walk to the beach.  The grounds are well maintained; the staff is friendly.  The pool is good sized with shallow and deep ends.  The hot tubs are warm tubs though.  The is a privately owned restaurant attached to the inn.  So what did we find wrong?  My wife are I were on vacation; we don't need to be awakened by a leaf blower right outside our door before 9 am.  The pool has 19 signs on fences and none of them are enforced.  We saw two couples with glass beer bottles in the pool area; one male drinker dropped ho bottle off the concrete.  There is a sign saying no diaper aged children in the pool.  There were three children younger than two in the pool with swim diapers on;

Poorly decorated, poor lighting inside and out, noisy, and a hard queen mattress.  The murphy beds were more comfortable then the queen in the bedroom, so we slept on those. The staff members were helpful and friendly. Sorry, but is our first and last stay here.

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now, as it is close to Camp Pendleton, and perfect for when my Marine leaves on deployment. Not a luxurious hotel, but spacious, clean rooms, large balcony, very pleasant, helpful staff, and ideal for families. Nice surroundings, beautiful atmosphere around Christmas time, with decorations, and a feeling of home.  I would stay here any time, but it was more out of convenience I chose this hotel in the first place, the second and third were by choice.

Summary Heading: The Good, the Bizarre, and the Horror
Summary: First, the Good... the woman who checked me in was extremely helpful. The Bizarre... the bed was in an alcove with no bedside table, and no reading light above. So after reading yourself to sleep you have to get up and cross the room to turn off the light! Anything that you would normally keep on the table like the phone or a glass of water, has to go on the floor. Aside from that it's your basic budget hotel but a nice kitchenette.      The Horror... there is a 10 am checkout time. At check in you must sign a contract agreeing to this and an exorbitant penalty if you overstay. Horror for somebody like me who comes to town to work a festival, 14 hour days with no break, cold supper in the room at 1 am. I desperately need to sleep in monday am before the drive home. Only the

Great experience. We had a nice stay at San Clement Inn during 4th July weekend.The staff is friendly and courtesy. Room is clean and really comfortable. The resort is close to downtown but far enough to give us a relaxing time. It has a restaurant in with a very yummy food.

Summary Heading: OLD AND MUSTY.  We could not stay in our room because of the musty, moldy odor.
Summary: Staff and property upkeep was very hit & miss.  The restaurant was a miss.  Service and food were both bad. The location is great but there are better places to stay just across the freeway. Living nearby, we often have overflow guests.  We will not geta room for them here.

We recently stayed here and had a great experience. The accommodations were clean, spacious and the amenities were good. Plenty to do around the hotel such as the comedy shows, rent movies, or use the rec center. Close to the beach. The pull-out beds from the walls were awesome and comfortable.

The room was too small for four people. The restaurant  in the hotel was excellent for breakfast. The free movies great plus. The game room air hockey,pool,fosseball . I just wish the room was bigger. San Clemente is a fun city.  I got groupons for local restaurants. The little kitchen was great for snacks and waffles one morning.  I brought my waffle iron from home.

This is a "condotel" as, at least, some of the units are timeshares. Did not see the larger unit, but ours was 280 square feet. Mini kitchen and a bed... Which was a mediocre mattress on a wooden pedestal. All this for the bargain price of about $125 a night when tax and booking (Hotwire) fees were included. It does have a pool. It does have a tennis court and game room. And, it does have a 9 hole putt-putt course. All of these things, however, do not make it the 3-star Hotwire purports it to be. This is a 2-star place at best.

Our family stayed in a one bedroom suite during spring break. The room was clean and it was nice that it had 2 murphy beds. The pool was a great afternoon activity for our boys and they rented free movies at the front desk. The beach is close by and several good restaurants as well. I would recommend staying here for a family that is active like ours. Since I am a travel agent, I am always looking at properties differently so I can refer or not to my clients. I would refer this property to other families traveling to Orange County.
