This was my first visit to San Clemente even though I am from California originally. My room was well sized. There were two bathrooms, a dining area, a living room area, kitchenette, separate bedroom, and two Murphy beds. There a lot of things to do on location at the hotel. It is also located very close to the state park and the beach. My daughter and I had many beautiful walks to the beach. My only complaint was that I had to have my keys recoded multiple times during my stay.

Summary Heading: Great Staff, Nice place....NO Shade trees??????
Summary: Nice rooms and a sweet vibe--low key feeling.  I was shocked to see all of the great shade trees ripped out on the back--- they have ruined the feel of the place back there....I hope they ae planing to replace them ALL with mature shade trees--- it sort of like a wal mart parking lot right now------  in any case---- it is still a good place-- I just hope the owners replace the trees and replace the ambiance they had for so many years....

My boyfriend and I stayed there on our way back from San Diego. We got there and we had to wait an hour to get our room. We were guaranteed the best room, we got a room with nothing but tree view. We walked down to the beach about a 10 min walk. I think that was the best part of our stay. We over slept in the morning and got a call from the front desk being extremely rude. Yeah, we did over sleep but we did wait an extra hour to even get the room. The housekeeping just leaves bags of trash outside of rooms. It was disgusting. I wouldn't stay here again.

San Clemente is a gorgeous vacation spot and the San Clemente Inn is conveniently located. It is very close to the beach which makes for a lovely walk. Lots to do at the hotel, including fitness room, pool tables, heated (really heated!) pool, and free current DVD's to borrow from the front desk. Next time we come we will bring the family.

very quiet and comfortable.   Lots of ammenties like miniature golf, billiards tables, heated swimming pool and jaccuzis.  Great place to take family (which I definately will).  Just a short walk to a beautiful beach!  Also has stove, microwave, refrigerator and dishwasher in studio rooms.

Get away for my husband and I. Bldg 1 top floor has a beautiful view! Staff is very friendly and accommodating, especially Richie who truly is customer service oriented! If this were a renovated property it could be so much better! Great proximity to the state park! Our room was very outdated, bordering on dingy. The couches saw better days, the bed was a double bed? I have never stayed in a resort with such a small bed? (And incredibly uncomfortable!)The AC unit is the similar to a window AC unit which is fine for a single room, but not great for a multi room dwelling..bathroom gets hot, bedroom stuffy..kitchen functional, but old..fridge very loud. Configuration of unit is also odd..2 toilets next to each other with a thin door between? TV not in front of couch, but in front

There are three main reasons to stay at San Clemente Inn: - Location - Amenities - Value  Location:  The Inn is located conveniently off the I-5 in San Clemente, a small coastal town known for it's great surfing. This is a very convenient place to stay in Southern California because it affords you access to plenty of beaches, surfing, whale watching, Legoland, Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, major league ballgames, and more. You can see the Inn's sign from the freeway. It's located right next to to a state park. On our trip we enjoyed boogie-boarding at the San Clemente beach near the pier, jogging along the sandy trail next to the RR tracks, visiting Disneyland, exploring Laguna Beach and the Marine Mammal Care Center, picking strawberries and looking at the gorgeous flowers in

Summary Heading: Great stay but sad it was too short
Summary: I stayed here with my son during Spring Break and found it to be an exceptional value. I booked it through Groupon because I had always wanted to check out the town and the beaches and saw it as a great chance to do so.   I found the hotel very easy to find from the 5 and it's location is in a somewhat residential area on the other side of the freeway from the business area. It was extremely quiet even with the highway close by. There was adequate parking and the spots unlike most in SoCal where large enough for a full size car.   The room was large and had a kitchenette with pots/pan/glasses, I didn't use any of these as my stay was only one night but it would be great for someone staying for a few days. The room also had a patio that sat looking at the shuffleboard area and

The room smell dingy, the bed covers looked like they were chewed up by rats, the phone cord was broke, the towels were stained, a lamp didn't work and the carpeting was torn. Suzanne from the front desk was very rude. She hung up on me before I was finished talking. Manual from house keeping told me all the blankets were torn.

My family and I stayed for 3 nights at the San Clemente Inn and we really enjoyed our stay!  The room was large, clean, and well appointed.  The kitchenette had everything you could need.  Every staff member we met from the front desk to the housekeeping staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  We loved all the amenities including shuffleboard, ping pong, and free games like Connect Four for the kids to play.  The location is a 2 minute drive from the beach with ample parking (for a fee) and 5 minutes from the little downtown strip with restaurants and shops.  We would definitely stay again.  The ONLY negatives were the extra firm bed (not my preference, but not uncomfortable!), and the very thin walls.  Seriously.  VERY.  THIN.  You could hear everything.  If not for the thin

First, I want to stay the staff here was amazing!  Every single person we met was wonderful from the front dest to the grounds crew and cleaning staff.  The location was convenient - right off the highway (although mapquest gives goofy instructions about how to get there!) and a good jumping off point for us, as we went all the way to Disneyland to the north and San Diego to the south.    The Inn is maybe a half mile above the beach and you have to pay to park there.  You cross the train tracks to walk down to the beach.  My 4 year old enjoyed watching the commuter and Amtrack trains going by.  We went to a LOT of different beaches and this one was actually my least favorite.  The San Clemente Pier is maybe a mile or two north and I recommend driving to that one or LaJolla,

Summary Heading: Wonderful for the price and you must go to Adele's!!!
Summary: We stayed here as a family of 5.  It is a quaint, cute, motel-inn-type of place.  Don't mind the reviews about Formica counters and outdatedness.  Yes this IS NOT the HYATT or FOUR SEASONS but it is a fair priced family accommodation with a very nice staff and comfortable beds etc.  What counts when you are traveliing with kids....comfort, enough space, and a good price.  Look for a groupon or some rate reducer.  The room may have had a bit too much furniture in it so made the fold out sofa bed a bit crowded.  The sofa bed was okay.  Manuel the night shift service man was wonderful and brought up a mattress topper for extra comfort.  He was gracious and kind. The place is lovely  Stay here...Ask for a room not facing the roadway.  They have a fairly large property so if you book

Summary Heading: Ok hotel in a GREAT location
Summary: We bought a groupon for this hotel and got the largest room. I was very surprised by the size and amenities in the room, but not really by the room itself. It is a 3 star hotel with a motel feel. It wasn't bad or gross.. Just ok. But what made the trip great was the location. It is literally a walk away from the beach. We paid $89 for a room for 6ppl so I still think it was a great deal, but I wouldn't pay much more considering the not quite clean feel of the place.

Check -in  was fast and efficient, very friendly staff. Housekeeping needs a little work on phone etiquette, but rooms were very clean, something you rarely see in a Vegas Hotel. Grounds are enjoyable, with lots to do, and location is great for getting around San Clemente. We will be returning!

Room was clean but very outdated.  Furniture and decor was acceptable but cabinets and countertops are Formica.....when was the last time you saw Formica?  Bed was a double and we thought we were getting a queen bed.  If you are used to the luxury of a Hilton timeshare this is not the place for you.  Felt like a stay at a Motel 6.   Room also had Murphy beds in living area.   Seriously? A Murphy bed?  Outdated again.  Check-in process is weird.  There is a list that is created of all parties checking-in in an order set by the inn.  What?  Names go in order beginning at 1 pm and  there is some printed material about following this and NOT questioning the front desk about this procedure.  The weirdest procedure we have ever seen.  A young gal at the front desk with excessive

Summary Heading: Excellent for family definitely coming back!
Summary: Arrived at the inn and was greeted very nicely at the desk. Given an upgrade, told about all of the fabulous kid activities within the hotel, air hockey, etc and free rental movies etc. Miniature golf will be done soon. Room is huge, twin Murphy beds in the living room and a separate bedroom for parents. Living room with 2 couches kitchen and tv. Awesome for $90!!!!  We are happy. And 25 miles from Lego land!

We love this spot  wehave been here about 5 times. Great for the price. Cute restaurant and pool area. Will come again. Rooms have everything..coffee pot, microwave, fridge, hair dryer. Check in smooth.

Summary Heading: A Little Different But We Enjoyed It. Great Location.
Summary: We were on an old fashioned family road trip and the kids wanted to surf in San Clemente. The San Clemente Inn offered a great rate and a great location. We were there for one night and the place suited us just fine. The kids got a kick out of the Murphy beds that pulled down from the wall ready to go. They actually were quite practical.  We didn't get a chance to use the amenities but the pool seemed nice.  The place seemed quirky in a nice charming way. Considering the very reasonable price and close proximity to a great beach we would come back in a heartbeat.  Note: Short drive from downtown San Clemente.

When my wife and I arrived at the resort we were surprised at how convienient the resort was to the I-5 highway.  We were impressed by the lovely lobby.  At check-in, the lady at the front desk  reccomended that we take room # 217. " It has an ocean view!', she said.  We accepted.  After finding the room and entering, we could't help noticing the old-looking decor.  I walked through the unit and decided it was o.k., but nothing to write home about.  My wife became very quiet and sat at the edge of the sofa.  I began to settle in and  noticed that she had not moved.  I tried to make conversation with her, but she just sat there staring at the floor.  I knew something was wrong!  After trying very hard to get her to say what was wrong ,for she was not her fun-loving self, she

Summary Heading: Denise at the front desk is horrible!
Summary: When we arrived at the hotel, we were rudely acknowledged by Denise who seemingly hates her life. She checked us in and gave us what felt like an eternity of papers to sign. She quickly told us what room we were staying and handed us our keys and sent us on our way. When we got into the room, the first thing we noticed was that it reeked of bleach. The second thing we noticed, was that it was a STUDIO when we had payed extra for a one-bedroom suite. We walked back to the lobby and confronted her kindly with our issue. She looked at us in disgust and tried to tell us that because there was only 2 of us that we didn't need a one-bedroom suite because it slept 4. She went as far as to double check my email confirmation that I had to pull up on my own phone and made us wait for at

Great place to stay in South San Clemente.  Helpful staff, rooms have recently all been redecorated.  A short walk from the beach.  Beds are pretty good, and all rooms have small kitchens, large fridge, stove, and patio decks with chairs.   Nice outdoor area, bbq's, tables you can use, pool, spa etc..  If you time it right room rates here are better than anywhere else and for the same price you'd end up with a lot less anywhere in the area

We came here because we like to camp at the nearby State Beach and this hotel offered a Group on so we figured it could be our colder weather trip to a place we love.  This is our second stay, we bought two Groupons.  The staff is friendly, always a smile from everyone.  The suites are stocked nicely and we love having the kitchenette.  Our boys love the DVD library with recent releases, the pool and child-specific spa and Murphy beds.  The hotel is walking distance from Calafia Beach.  The accommodations are not perfect but they are very nice and we like it here.

After a nice check in process, everything went downhill.  Room very shabby, not a comfortable piece of furniture in the place.  Bed was the same as sleeping on concrete with rocks for pillows.  Other than the pleasant woman who checked us in, staff was indifferent.  Husband tried to buy paper, machine took money and did not open.  Staff at desk said not our problem--have to contact LA Times ourselves for refund--unlike every other place we have stayed that would have refunded lost dollars and dealt with supplier themselves.  Just one example of how disappointed we were in this stay.

Summary Heading: An average place in a great location
Summary: The San Clemente Inn has wonderful emplyees--Susan at the front desk and staff maintaining the grounds and rooms are fantastic and an asset to the Inn.  There is a tennis court; we used the pool and hot tub (which could have been 5-10 degrees hotter).  The ocean view rooms view tree tops, houses, and a sliver of the Pacific. The shampoo and bar soap in the room are horrible--the low bidders.  Be sure to bring your own shampoo and bar soap.  The room was clean and spacious.  It is a three block walk to the beach. The restaurant is not owned by the Inn; Pete and Adele own it and work there.  Pete is the friendly waiter.  Service was prompt and the food was a good value.  We did not participate in Drag Queen Night. We used RCI points for the Inn; be forewarned of the $36 cleaning

We have stayed at San Clemente Inn number of times before, it's a timeshare also.  First time we stayed in their Studio and it's not worth it.  Last few times we have been staying in the smaller one bedroom (Breaker) and it's perfect for 3 of us.  The bedroom is little small but good to have a separate room.  The room also has a two murphy beds so plenty of sleeping space.  There is a small kitchenette with fridge, microwave, Mini dishwasher, pots and pans etc.. Very very convenient and saves money on eating out too often. They could add a few things, a non-stick pan and salt and pepper shaker but that's minor stuff.  The balcony is nice and big.   Next time I will try the Crest unit, which is bigger and has a sofa bed but only $20 dollars more.      They remodeled the place

1 bedroom says 6 people but it really is too small. 4 people comfortably. Small 2 burner stove and microwave. Can't really make a meal other than to heat something.  Nice people that work there.  We stayed at Disney a couple of days and we drove to San Diego, very nice.

Although this is advertised and posted as a non-smoking property. That policy is not enforced.  If you have asthma or other bronchial issues it is too bad.  For some reason there are huge numbers of smokers on this property more so than you would expect.  The humidity hangs on to the smoke so that it sits in the air.  We could not even enjoy our balcony due to the poor air quality from the heavy smoking all around us

Like any stay should be, ours was seamless and comfortable from start to finish.  Be ready to experience contemporary furnishings with well maintained grounds, the front desk and service folks are always at the ready.  I will definitely recommend the San Clemente Inn!

Although we are not on the beach, we are within easy walking distance to a path to the beach.  Unit has been fully remodeled/updated.  Nice big balcony with table and chairs.  One bedroom also has 2 murphy beds if needed.  Adequate kitchen.  Lots of sunshine in the room!  Great rec area!  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  We do hear freeway traffic if you sit outside, but the view is hillside and still very nice.  Units are not large, but nicely arranged.  Would stay here again.

The room was nice and cozy. Had a nice firm bed and had two Murphy's bed and a pull out. Plenty of room to sleep. Nicely equipped kitchette. Parking and facilities are spacious. Staff was friendly and nice. Very informative. Make sure to check out Adele's.

We were very impressed with every aspect of our stay at the San Clemente Inn. Their staff was excellent. The room was more than what we expected. There is a lot to do at the Inn itself and a short walk to the beach.. We will be coming back!!!!!

I recently stayed at the San Clemente Inn and I must say it was my first and last time visiting this place. Their check in process is ridiculous, you need to be present between 1:00pm until the time they call your name otherwise the room assigned to you will be the parking lot (almost). The lady who calls out the names constantly repeats herself letting everyone know if they don't respond to their names by the 2nd call they will go to bottom of her list, meaning they will get one of the worst rooms.  Not only is this a waste of time, the process is almost humiliating.The rooms are outdated and boring. At first glance the rooms seem clean but when you look closer you will find out the room needs some special attention.  My husband and I love visiting San Clemente but staying at

I had a great room - sleeping 6 people, with I 1/2 bathrooms, 3rd floor garden/pool view, sounds good.  But then the smoke alarm went off 3 times that night (from 11 p.m. -  7 a.m., approx. every 3 hours) - that was supposedly fixed.   Also,  my next door neighbor at 6:30 a.m. slams the front door when leaving, and again when arriving so hard that I thought we had an earthquake.  He did this every day.  Remember that smoke alarm that was fixed - well it sounded off again.  At that point I  asked to be moved to another unit.   They did not have a unit comparable to my unit so I had to settle for a smaller unit with a view of the parking lot..   Other than the above problems I had a good stay, and still recommend the San Clemente Inn .  I found the entire staff was  friendly,

Summary Heading: Not fair pricing, an attempted pricing rip-off !!
Summary: When my husband and I were trying to find a last-minute over-night stay to connect with and entertain our grandchildren for the evening, I called this hotel from the freeway and was quoted a price over the phone of $100 for a full kitchen unit per night. Only 3-4 minutes later, we arrived at The San Clemente Inn and my husband was told that the exact room was now priced at over $130. When I confronted reception regarding the discrepancy in cost, she did lower the cost; however, it did not instill a feeling of honesty regarding staff. The positive: the grounds were well-groomed.

The place is fantastic! All new carpeting, bedding, and bedroom furnishings. The staff was incredibly friendly and our room was spotless! This room is far better than the Hilton we stayed at last year. We'll be back.

Location is great (right up the hill from the beach), rooms are clean, facility is a little outdated, but it's a nice timeshare in an area where timeshares are hard to come by.  We have stayed four times and have enjoyed our stay every time.  The galley kitchen is a nice bonus and helps you save money, because you don't have to eat every meal out.

I stayed at this hotel for three nights while in the area to attend my sons graduation from Camp Pendleton.  The only complaint I have about the Hotel, is a pervasive odor in the room.  I had a "no smoking" room, however there was the odor of stale tobacco smoke, or something similar in the room.  Other than that, the room was very clean, well furnished, and the location was great.  The queen bed was a little hard for my taste, and the pillows were quite plump, something I'm not used to.  I had breakfast at the on site restaurant, Adeles, the service was excellent and the food good.  Bottom line, I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: The Land of Adventure and Relaxation
Summary: I found the location of the San Clemente Inn wonderful.  Nestled in between San Diego and Los Angles, this spot provides both adventure and relaxation in spades.  The inn is very close to a state park and the view I spectacular!  If you want to stay on the grounds and chill out, it‚Äôs easy and simple.  If you want to go out and explore the surrounding countryside and/or park, that‚Äôs easy to do as well.    The rooms are spacious and well appointed with modern conveniences while maintaining an old world charm, including DVD player and full kitchen if desired.   The d√©cor is both warm and clean and I really loved that each room is No Smoking Allowed.  I would like there to be a pet policy but I can live with that for now because everything else is so great.

My family and I just returned from our vacation. The San Clemente Inn is our family favorite. The d√©cor has been updated and is so comfortable. The staff is excellent and attentive. The state park is within walking distance and the beach is right down the hill!

This place is so easy and comfortable. I love Adeles on site. San clemente beach is a 10 minute walk. I can ride my bike from here into town. San Clemente is a lovely beach community. If I could bring my dog here it would be perfect!

Summary Heading: If I had to stay in San Clemente  again this wouldnt be my first choice.
Summary: After staying here for a wedding I cant quite say this "hotel" is worth being called one. Its more a over glorified motel, 2 levels with a pool restaurant/bar  and billiards room.        Check in is at 3pm however they have something called Pre- registering which allows at 1pm to check in if you are an early arrival though this does pretty much absobs small surf town )so if you are looking for to sleep in on a vacation before you leave, DONT COUNT ON IT HERE .  They expect you to call between 7am - 9 am the day of checkout for a request of a later exit time.  And dont expect to get any simpathy from their staff... They have two very nice ladies at the front desk, but when speaking to the manager like the ladies, they blame the company on not being accommodating.   Now as far as

The reviews here are generally right on and don't need further explanation.  If you enjoy a small unit within easy reach of the beach for swimming and sunsets, this is a good choice in OC.  Here are a few comments and tips: 1.  Unlike most timeshares there is daily maid service and plentiful towels provided.  This is a serious bonus if you visit the beach frequently. 2.  Weeks turnover is Sunday.  There is a lot of competition for the prime rooms on Sunday afternoon.  Check-in is 4pm, but the staff will allow pre-registration at 1pm.  On Sundays there is a crowd of people in the lobby waiting to snatch up the best rooms.  We checked in on Friday of Labor Day Weekend and snagged two prime rooms (3rd floor, facing state park, ocean view) just by showing up at 1pm...no competition.

Summary Heading: A great relaxing place to stay
Summary: If you like being near the beach, but not right on it in the crowds, this is the place to go. Rooms with ocean views, sunsets, clean and comfy, and near the sights, kitchens to prepare your own meals, or an onsite restaurant or any kind of restaurant you could want right nearby. Pool, Jacuzzis, saunas, game and exercise rooms, outdoor activities on site. Worth the time to drive from WA!

We thoroughly enjoyed our week at the San Clemente Inn with our two grandsons. It is wallking distance to the beach and the boys love taking the trails through the State Park. The one bedroom condo was recently remodled and the twin Murphy beds worked out pertect for the boys. The ammenneties are so numerous;pool tables, fooze ball, air hockey, tenis,basketball, ping pong, suffleboard, as well as heated pool and spas for kids and adults. All the staff were so friendly and cheerful in providing equipment for games and free movies. We hope to return in the future.

just returned from the San Clemente Inn and would definitely do it again. Nice queen sized bed in the bedroom with plenty of room to set up our little one's pack and play. A little warm in the room because the AC didn't reach in there when the door was closed. Clean room, plenty of room throughout the whole condo. My husband and I slept in the "I love Lucy" beds (murphy beds) and they were very comfortable. Lots to do around the complex. My son loved the pool and the kids hot tub. They had two of them....one for kids that was kept at 90 degrees and an adult only hot too as well. The pool was a very comfortable tempuratue as well. Beach was a short walk down the street next to the complex. No sidewalk on the road, which of course isn't the fault of the San Clemente Inn. 30

Summary Heading: horrible room smell.  not worth your money.
Summary: I wondered why there was no picture of rooms.  that should of been my first clue.  room has this horrible OLD building stinch! First whif in the lounge has same old rotting stinch... rooms are old and dirty... YUCK.   it was complete waste of money..  they have  horrible moldy rotting smell.

Summary Heading: Close to the beach, fun for families!
Summary: We stayed for a week and went to the beach 5 out of 7 days because it was only 1/4 mile away. A half hour from Disneyland too!  The rooms were cleaned daily and if we needed anything, a call to the front desk quickly resolved that.  The layout of the room was a little weird, and I was a little disappointed that kids in diapers were not allowed in the pool, but besides that, it was a great stay

We came as a reunion group of 45, and all stayed in various units on the property; everyone seemed generally pleased with the accommodations.  The Murphy beds and curtain divider with sleeper sofa was perfect for our family of 6 (in unit 132).  Our room backed on the road, but it was still quiet.  The pool and grassy areas were nice.  My only complaints were no hooks/clotheslines to hang wet suits/towels (so everyone put them on the railings, which was officially forbidden), the pillows are super poofy so i had to sleep without or hurt my neck, and the beach access is along a busy road with no sidewalk.

I am a native of this area, but moved away a few years ago. I like to go back and enjoy the beach a few times in the summer. I recently stayed at San Clemente Inn. I know this is a very old property, but thought it had been well maintained. I was wrong.  The first thing that greets you when you enter the lobby is the old, musty smell that some older hotels in the beach area have. The units aren't much better, although, the one I was in appeared to have been refurbished something in the past, it still had that smell and the noisey plumbing wakes you at night when neighbors run water.  Most units sleep 4, but have only one mirror---in the bathroom. Really?   I had a problem with the staff not respecting my privacy. The maintenance man came by in the moring and wanted to come

Summary Heading: I would rather sleep in my car.
Summary: The exterior was appalling, the room was filthy, my bedspread was sticky and the sheets were not white. I could hear televisions above me and televisions beside me... people walking outside and cars going by.   If you're forced to stay here, I suggest bringing a small fan to provide white noise or wear ear-plugs during dinner.  Being in the military for 8 years, I'm no stranger to dirt, but this place was disgusting.  I'll attach a photo so you can see for yourself. .

Summary Heading: Really good for a beach family trip
Summary: This hotel has fully equipped kitchenettes and on site BBQs. The best place if you like to prepare your own meals. It has comfortable rooms and it's situated at walking distance of Calafia Beach, so you can avoid the parking fees at the shore. They offer free rental DVDs and other fun activities for the kids like mini golf, tennis, swimming pool, games... Also half way of Disneyland and San Diego Sea World, Zoo... I will come back in the future. David

We have returned from staying at the San Clemente Inn and had a great time. We stayed in two one bedroom suites for 7 days. The rooms are a little basic but spotless and the staff, resort facilities and location more than make up for this. we travelled with two kids age 13 and 17 and they loved the pool, free games centre, gym, free dvd hire and tennis. We used the on site BBQs three times and this was a great change from eating huge American meals. We also used the laundry facilities to make sure we came home with no washing. the location is great 10 minutes walk to the beach and a five minute drive into the centre of San Clemente. The reception staff were extremely helpful at all times and nothing was a bother to them. The cleaning and maintenance staff were also very friendly

Summary Heading: Not a place for R & R
Summary: This hotel was a terrible experience, it was just like camping but without a view of the beach and sand. The service was horrible, the beds were uncomfortable, the spa was nasty, the rooms are run down. Would never ever go back.

Stayed one night with 2 teenagers.  It was overcast and gloomy and we enjoyed the warm salted pool during the day. The room provides plenty of towels for showering and for the pool. The kids really liked sleeping in their own twin beds while watching the free rented movies.  All the staff was friendly and helpful. The grounds are clean and there's plenty of parking.  We will return to this property.

great location for vacation. Clean rooms with small kitchens. Really enjoyed our stay. Staff is very helpful.nice saltwater pool with an adult Spa and childrens spa. charcoal barbecue area andtennis courts. 3 blocks from the beach.

excellent service, perfect for family, beautiful area.  definitely would stay again!  There was a beach within a 10 minute walk, with water warm enough to swim in, excellent boogie boarding, surfing.  The indoor rec room has foosball, air hockey, pool tables, outdoor has mini golf, ping pong table, 90 degree pool and separate hot tubs (adult, kid).

We stayed at the beach property in early June.  Could not have been more pleased.  The condo was very clean and only a block from the beach.  Close to shopping and restaurants.  If you are looking for a peaceful paradise this is the place for you.  Will definitely return.....

Summary Heading: Great Place To Spend Some Quality Time
Summary: First time staying here but would definitely come here again.  Great location and fantastic staff who truly want you to enjoy your stay! The kitchenette is very adequate and the recreation room has everything to keep you entertained. Did I mention the swimming pool and hot tubs?

Summary Heading: Love it!  Close to the beach!!!
Summary: This place has a really nice location right off the 5 and close to the beach.  Though it's close the the 5 it's very quiet.  The hot tubs and pool are very nice.  There is a great game room in the clubhouse with pool, air hockey, a television, and foosball.  The walk to the beach is short and there is a great running trail along the beach.  The Surfliner station isn't far, if you'd like to ride someplace.  You can ride your bike south quite a ways without dealing with traffic, through  the San Onofre Nuclear Plant, State Park and Camp Pendleton.  The rooms are all newly updated.  Granite counters.  New carpet, furnishings, cabinets, decor.    Check out the Surfin' Donuts on the other side of the 5.  Best fritter you will ever eat. Seriously.  The closest Mexican restaurant is El

This is the second time we stayed here and it is even better than before. The rooms have been updated since our last stay and the grounds are immaculate. The staff is very friendly and helpful and answered all our questions. It's also nice to have a place that doesn't kill you with extra charges for everything. They offer free wifi,movie checkout,games and more.Also,the onsite restaurant is convenient and very reasonable. This is an ideal location to explore north and south along the california coast. both LA and San Diego are within 50 miles,with plenty of attractions in between. We will definitely be back.

The rooms were very nice.  All the amenities for the hotel were great.  Good spot for kids.  200 yards to the beach.  Rec room, exercise facility, rental bikes, and lots of other activities make this place very user friendly.  You can walk easily to the village where there are many places to dine.

Best in area for the rate! Needs a few Tweaks i.e. ice machines but overall very good. close to everything. Adeles is great especially the "KILLER HASHBROWNS". The "CREST" units are the best. The staff are very pleasant and accommodating.

We absolutely LOVED the San Clemente Inn!  Our suite had one queen in a seperate bedroom, with two twin murphey beds in the living room. It was the perfect set up for our family of 4. Everything was new, modern and spotless. The pool and spa were great too. Only a few blocks to the beach. Friendly staff to top it all off. We WILL be back!

This is the fifth time we've been back to San Clemente Inn, so no prizes for guessing how much we like it. It captures the essence of the town itself; homey, easy going, friendly, convenient - all the good stuff.  It's true to say that over the years it's got steadily better as the facilities and apartments have been refreshed and upgraded. The facilities include a good pool, tennis courts, outdoor and indoor games, Adele's great restaurant, gym, sauna, barbecue, and lovely grounds. The staff are always welcoming, courteous and helpful. Suffice to say we'll be back again.

Summary Heading: Very nice home away from home place to stay
Summary: We have been here awhile visiting and it has been very Pleasant! The pool is nice the gym...We love eating  at Adele's the food is great! The staff are very friendly and accommodating! It is close to downtown San Clemente and a lot to do shopping  and nice restaurants.The rooms are  decorated nicely.There is everything you need to cook small meal.House keeping keeps rooms nice and clean.

You can't beat the easy access to the beach, the state park, the many, many water activities in Dana Point about 4 miles away, and the ability to use the  Metrolink and trains to get to San Diego without fighting the traffic.  It's a lovely vacation mecca for all age groups of people.  The front desk staff is as warm as an ideal family member.  Attentive, practical and helpful.  I appreciate that this resort has all sorts of recreational activity options  and a business center.   Unlike most others, they charge you extra for nothing.  Current movie DVDs are loaned for free, as well.  The best thing about this resort is that a visit here means "No Worries."

The hotel was very cosy and nice. My wife and I had a great time and a wonderful stay at one of there basic rooms. The staff was great and the women an the front desk (I believe her name  was Jill) was very helpfull and kind, as was all the staff. I'd recommend this place for the price, and all the amenities the hotel has to offer.

My friends and I had an overall great stay. The staff was really friendly and the rooms were just recently renovated, so everything was new and very clean. They have a great pool area and restaurant on site that had live entertainment on the weekends. We came on their off season I guess, so we got a killer rate on the room as well! (Rooms are huge for the money!) Cheap and quick Cab ride to downtown SC for drinks Dinner and fun... Always a good time!

My family and I just stayed at the San Clemente Inn and had a wonderful experience. Everything from the staff, to the unit, to the numerous amenities made our trip truely special. The units are large and come equiped with kitchenettes that include all the utensils and place settings you need to cook a great meal. The Inn has tons of amenities including a pool, two jacuzzis, sports court, tennis court, recreation room, gym, and men/womens saunas. They also have free WIFI on site,free parking, and a great restaurant which was a perk in itself. The staff made us feel so welcome. This resort is a great value!

Summary Heading: Many Broken Things in the Room
Summary: The place had a lot of vacancies so why don't they place guests in rooms that don't have broken bathroom towel bars, broken air-conditioners, and broken telephone cords?  Could it be because all the rooms are in that condition?  In addition to all the broken annoyances in the room, the walkways around the place flood badly even in light rain.  And when it rains, the Wifi Internet does not work.  We spent a whole week there sleeping on a very hard mattress.  The staff were very friendly and courteous, but hardly make up for the above mentioned annoyances.  They did, however, decorate the lobby extremely well for Christmas.  They should be working at a better place than San Clemente Inn.  We will not be staying there again.

We  are  here for the last  week  in  November  & extremely satisfied with all  aspects  of  the  resort.  The lobby is decorated beautifully for Christmas & gets  one  in  the  Holiday Spirit  upon arrival. Room is comfortable, clean, & furniture updated.  Great experience all  way 'round espeially when  you  consider  the great  location.  B  &  F.   Z.

Summary Heading: Another awesome stay at the San Clemente inn!
Summary: I just got back from another awesome stay at the San Clemente inn and realized I have never written a review.   We stayed in a recently renovated room with a view of the state park. The rooms are well-equipped with kitchenettes and a balcony. There are tons of recreation activities on site to keep kids and adults entertained. They also have free movie rentals, free wifi and tons of parking. And no resort fees!! The staff is all super friendly and the prices are very reasonable... One of the best deals in San Clemente. One thing to keep in mind is that this is a timeshare, not a traditional hotel. So, don't expect daily cleaning or room service. They will come take out your trash, replenish towels and make the beds daily though. All in all, a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: A hotel that caters to your needs.
Summary: The hotel is right by the ocean. The rooms are spacious and the staff is friendly. A very home-like experience. Great location and wonderful service. Especially during the holiday season, the hotel is highly decorated.

San Clemente Inn has been a life saver for myself and family. My house flooded and I needed a hotel room for a month and two weeks. This hotel was absolutely accommodating to all my families needs. The HOTEL STAFF IS WONDERFUL, THE BEST EVER. Especially Suzanne and Frankie. The housecleaning staff is wonderful as well. There is a fully stocked kitchen with dishes, pots, and pans. A stove a microwave and a fridge. A separate bedroom and two other beds in another room. There is a nice private patio.  Two T.V.'s. I will always recommend this hotel because it is the best. It has the nicest pool, jacuzzi, and game rooms. It has been a great home away from home. I can not thank the staff enough for helping me through such a difficult time. Suzanne was the best, she always made time to

I found the rooms to be dark and a little damp.  The bed in this room was a murphy, kind of weird. Suite style room.  Best part of staying here was that it was in waking distance to the OC Tavern. A couple of shady people lurking around.

Spent a week here and found the staff friendly and helpful. As you will read in other reviews, the property is older. We are a family of four and had the largest room (one bedroom) the property offers - a single bedroom, two Murphy beds for the kids, and one and a half baths (the kids had their own bath with sink, but we all shared the one shower in the master bath.) However, we found the rooms spacious enough that we left the Murphy beds down the entire length of our stay and had plenty of room left over to eat and use the living area.  Very convenient location right off the freeway and about a 30 minute drive to Disneyland (and on California freeways, that's GOOD travel time!) Went up to Hollywood one day and enjoyed a number of attractions in that area. A short drive down to

We had a great first impression at our check in.  She was very courteous, welcoming and informative.  The grounds are pretty and well maintained.  The furniture is a bit dated but was clean and comfortable.  It is an older property and smells musty.  We got a room that looked out at the grassy, garden area and it was quiet and pretty.

We had planned to go to Virginia Beach but changed plans when we heard of a hurricane coming, Southern Cal. Seemed like a good alternative and we were quite pleased.    At this hotel (a timeshare property), you should not expect ultra modern.  I understand it was constructed as a hotel during the Nixon presidency when it was needed to house the entourage that followed Nixon when the "Western White House" was occupied.  It still shows remnants of the 60's construction.  This did not bother us.  Kithen cabinets abd all fixtures and appliances have been updated.  We stayed in a one bedroom unit for a very reasonable price(off season)".  The layout was unusual with a very small bedroom but plenty of closet space.  We had a third floor unit with a distant ocean view and a view of the

We recently spent a week at San Clemente Inn and enjoyed the great weather and proximity to ocean, restaurants and nearness to both LA and SD.  Problem was the unit seemed dark, worn and tired. Furniture and carpet were needed cleaning badly. Grounds are next to SC State Park and walking distance to beach which save it from being a total loss.

This place is just awful..........the beds are old and the platforms that they are on are filthy...the so called renovation is a joke....the lobby has a peculiar odor and seems to be the only place they care about besides the landscaping.  The rooms are somewhat "surface clean" and this is not a family friendly place seems like they are steering it towards seniors only....Kids can't even play pool even with an adult attending....must be 18! Pool closes at 10pm and the place literally shuts down, it is right next to the freeway and nothing else.  Nothing in walking distance, too far to walk down town....The blankets on the beds are stained and have holes in them so bring your own. The matresses are awful, like sleeping on an ironing board. The only good thing about this place is

We joined some friends at their timeshare unit here.  The first thing I noticed was that the staff were having lots of fun with the Halloween decorations in the lobby, which was just terrific in my book!  The grounds were very pretty with lots of green grass and little extra touches like Japanese bridges and a gazebo.    The units were fairly well stocked, clean and comfy.  The one we were in was a one bedroom with one and a half baths, but had twin Murphy beds which were extremely comfortable and well appointed with two pillows each and more than enough sheets/blankets.  There is closet space galore in this unit to stow things until you need them and a reasonable though not outstanding variety of utensils, glassware, plates etc.  The kitchen is small but contains a full size

Summary Heading: Great Property in an even Greater Location !
Summary: This is my 2nd stay at the San Clemente Inn in 2 years.  I love this little gem.  The property is older, not pretentious, homey, and very well loved by the management team.  It has gone through a major renovation of most of the guest suites.  The remaining ones will be completed sometime in early 2013.  The suites (all suite Timeshare Property) are beautifully renovated with modern, stylish inviting furnishings. Very clean and well maintained.   New appliances in the kitchens, new tile, carpet, furniture etc.  I have stayed in the studio and one bedroom suites and loved them both.     The staff I have found always to be friendly, accomodating to the best of their abilities.  I don't know why anyone would have complaints about the staff.  Being a Timeshare, things do run a bit

I was hesitant to go here after reading some reviews but our experience here was terrific.  There is so much to do on the grounds and the beach is not far.  They have daily maid service, charcoal bbq pits, pool, jacuzzis (2, 1 for children) 2 pool tables, foosball table,ping pong table and air hockey table.  They also have a basketball court, volleyball, golf putting and tennis courts.

Summary Heading: Alot of nice, a little of o.k.
Summary: Our family has done quite a few exchanges over the years, so we are used to getting into resorts that may be struggling a little. This could be one of those resorts, but there's alot of really good things about staying here.   The check-in process was the weirdest we've ever experienced. We were told the choice of rooms is based on our position on the list. We were 45 of 50 or so, and told to be back at 1pm when they start calling names. Being able to "choose" a room was nice, but really stinks for the guests that can't be there at 1pm to get in on the game. But for us it worked out just fine.   We chose room 150, which is on the ground level, adjacent to the gate to the pool, and a hop over the patio railing had us easy access to the BBQ. The only caveat is the bedroom window

Just spent weekend at SC Inn with wife and 4 kids (ages 8 to 15). San Clemente is a great beach town and the location of the SC Inn allows quick access right down the road (about a 3 block steep walk or quick car run) to Calafia Beach... one of the best. We found the Inn itself to have a friedly / helpful front desk and staff.... and a few fun qualities for kids... decent size pool, shuffleboard, pool tables. As for the quality of the rooms themselves... unquestionably dated and weak. Furnishings old and drab, a few small cockroaches in the bathroom, and the old TV had problems. Best only for families and budget travelers who want this location at a reasonable price.

As a timeshare owner I have a pretty good idea of what I expect upon arriving at another resort. The San Clemente Inn was something I was not prepared for. Let me start By saying that my day of travel began at 2:45am est, we arrived at the San Clemente Inn at 1:34pm pst, and found out that I was #14 on a list of 72 names that had to be called for registration. They started calling names at 1:00, and we're now up to 26, I was informed that since I was not here when my name wa called that I would have to wait for all the names to be called and the list to begin again. At 3:07 my name was finally called. We were assigned a room, which I was told would be cleaned by 4:00pm. At 5:00pm we finally got into our room.  Upon entering the room, we found dirty sheets and blankets on the

This place was very nice!  We had been in an automobile accident a couple of days before.  We were all beat and bruised up.  I had a cracked rib.  The staff was gracious enough to put us in a handicap room.  It was super nice and made things so much easier.

Summary Heading: Best Hidden asset in san Clemente
Summary: We stayed at The San Clemente Inn in Mar. 2012 for 6 nights.  The resort is very clean, quiet and well located. A state park is right around the corner and the 5 Freeway is 2 blocks away. Close to shopping and restaurants.  Very helpful and friendly staff, can`t wait to return on our next trip.

Summary Heading: Worst experience I have ever had!
Summary: Well, gee, where should I begin?  First off we were part of a wedding party scheduled for Sunday, July 15th 2012 at the gorgeous Historic cottage in San Clemente. The venue said that the San Clemente Inn would be happy to accommodate us during our stay and it was only a minute from the venue, so we gladly booked. Granted, no one told us while making our reservation that it was a VRI or we would have gladly stayed anywhere else. We were told that we could check-in at 1pm, giving us plenty of time to shower and prepare ourselves for the wedding. However, we learned from the very rude people at the front desk that we were #62 on the list of 65 to check-in early. We had to wait for names to be called from a list. If we missed our names being called then we were sent to the bottom of

Summary Heading: A good place to stay close to the beach
Summary: This is a newly renovated hotel.  My husband and I stayed in a studio room.  The kitchenette was fully equipped with plates, utensils, cookware, etc.  This was nice but be forewarned that this hotel is not within walking distance of grocery or convenience stores.  You will need a car to get to the nearest grocery store.  There was lots of cabinet space in the bathroom and the sink is separate from the shower area--convenient for two people getting ready to go.  They have done a nice job overall with the refurbishment but the bed and pillows were a little too firm for my taste.  The hotel offers a lot of activities for families, such as shuffle board, the pool, and ping pong table, tennis and basketball courts,-.  All equipment may be checked out from the hotel.  Also, board

Used our timeshare exchange for our 6 night stay.  Great location right off the interstate.  Easy travel to all our outings in LA.  Slightly disappointed in the resort itself.  Our room faced the the other building so we had no view at all.  Room itself was decent.  Two murphy beds were great for our kids and really comfortable too.  No shower pressure and no stove.  Other than that had all the necessities.  tv's were both old.  Amenities were good.  Pool, hot tubs, billiards, air hockey, ping pong, badminton, tennis...free movie rental.  lots to keep us occupied at night.  Adele's restaurant on site was great too.    Easy walk down the hillside to the beach.  Awesome beach and lots of people using it.  They say location location location!!!

We stayed there for a Mother's Day long weekend.  The place is nothing fancy, but has all the essentials.  We had a one-bedroom that comes with two murphy beds in the living room, a shower but no bath tub, a partial kitchen with two burners, microwave, and dish washer.  Balcony is nice and big.  We spent a lot of time on the balcony, even though we could only see the rooms from other building and the sky between two buildings :).    One not so good thing about this place is that their beds are very old and very hard to sleep on.  Although they started to re-model the place and replace some of the beds, you can't really get those rooms unless you are the timeshare owner or exchange guests.  We were there @ 1 pm to "pre-check-in" and hoping to get a room with a new bed, but with

Summary Heading: Best Location of any beach Hotel in America!
Summary: Watching world-class surfing right outside your door!  Amazing place to stay with GREAT amenities and excellent golf nearby. Very good value.

We have stayed at San Clemente Inn at the end of October 2011. Our experience with the resort was very positive. The staff was very, very helpful describing local attractions, restaurants and things to do. We where impressed with FREE Wi-Fi and strong connection. My wife had to do quite a bit of work on line and it went very smoothly. We had one bedroom which was comfortable. Kitchen had hot plate and no oven

My daughter and I visited San Clemente after the holidays to spend a few days with my son and grandsons. The one other time we visited that sweet little seaside town, the San Clemente Inn was booked, but this time there was availability for all three days of our trip.  Lucky for us!!  This place is such a fabulous little hidden gem!  I still can't believe all the amenities they provide for such reasonable rates, not to mention the comfort, conveniences, and CLEANLINESS (number one requirement in my book!!!).  The staff members we encountered were delightful in all cases; helpful, efficient, knowledgeable, pleasant, courteous . . . no complaints whatsoever from this traveler!  The room was HUGE, with a separate bedroom, two pristeen twin-size murphy/wall beds in the living area

Had a wonderful stay at the San Clemente Inn.  They had a fun game room with 2 pool tables, foosball, ping pong, air hockey and fun crafts in the afternoon.  The swimming pool was also nice.  Nothing very special, but nice.

We were Grandma and Grandpa in town for Thanksgiving and felt right at home. We attended aand recommendthe regular Monday mixer hosted by activities director Mike. Needless to say Mike is an enthusiast. There is plenty to do at the resort and nearby.   Mike, Nick and Catherine at reception are knowledgeable, polite and helpful.. . This is a family friendly place. There are kids around but noise is well controlled. House cleqning staff aqre friendly and helpful.   We arrived late and couldn't access a better room, but Catherine the  top notch receptionist urged us to stop by the front desk next morning. Sure enough we got easily transferred to a unit with a splendid ocean view.   Adele's eatery on site is standard for Breakfast.

The hotel itself is dated but unit was clean and housecleaning visited each day to remove garbage and provide fresh towels. Best of all was the location as the beach was a five minute walk away, LA was one hour drive north, and San Diego was one hour south. You could hop on the Coaster train which was a 15 minute drive to Oceanside if you wanted a more relaxed mode of transport - the Coaster took you into the bus terminal in San Diego where you could catch the Historic Trolley Tour or local buses.

We stayed here for one night over the weekend. We chose this inn since we're meeting up wth our friends who were camping at the San Clemente Beach Park next door. We took our bikes and rode to the campground, the beach and a mini market across the street. Very convenient.  We had one of their breaker units which is a tight one bedroom apartment for four with a small kitchen and a sneak peek ocean view from the balcony. The decor and furnitures were stuck in the 70's. Our kids thought the murphy beds were the coolest. This place has obviously seen better days. The apartment is clean, kitchen is well stocked for cooking but everything in it says old and used. If one can look past rusted shower head, worn towels, thin walls, old carpet or flat pillows with old bedsheets then it's a

My wife and 4 kids travel 6 to 10 times a year for fun. We have stayed in many different places. Overall I really liked this place. But there were just a couple weird things that didn't do it for me . First the good. Off the beaten path just enough to be peaceful. Close to beach access just down the road. The land scape was clean and neatly groomed. The grounds offered more than your every day inn. BBQ's, Grass play area for kids, miniature golf area, and a decent size pool. Our room had almost everything we needed which is tough for us with teens, and an infant all included in our gang.  We stayed in one of the mini suits. Plenty of beds, microwave, sink, fridge, cooking utensils, dvd player, plus regular Sat TV in two rooms, dining table, back balcony, 1 full bath and one 1/2

Our family has been staying here for 12 years straight. Used to be a wonderful place, but is in need of serious repair. Our room was dirty, furnature was old and dirty we had to put towels on the couch  just to sit on it, smelled like urine, stains on the walls everywhere, broken appliances and the staff that used to be amazing has changed and not for the better! There are some areas that are still very nice but there is no way to insure you get to be in a nice room or area.even if you pay extra. So for the same price of a 4 star room you may get a 1 star room and the staff is rude and unhelpful regarding that fact. Maybe if they changed their rate policy and charged less for the broken down rooms their customers would not feel ripped off! BE WARNED this place is a crap shot now.

We always enjoy this quiet, quaint resort in sunny Southern Cali.  The staff at San Clemente Inn is super friendly, often going above and beyond responding to our requests.  The rooms are clean with just the right amount of amenities and we love keeping the windows open in the evenings to listen to the ocean.  The location is withing walking distance to the San Clemente beach, which is SUPER clean and a short drive to the local shopping and dining.  We enjoy the pool, the hot tub, and Adele's restaurant the most. This is a very laid back, relaxing place to visit!

We were wary after reading some of the reviews.  So much so that I called the resort and asked some questions before exchanging through RCI.  I was assured that the units were clean and we would not be disappointed, so we went ahead and booked.  We listened to other reviewers and were there for early check in.  The rooms are generally not ready until 3 or 4PM but to get your choice of rooms you need to show up early for the best selection.  We requested a "renovated" unit which was ready by 2PM and, although still a bit dated, was very clean and comfortable.  It was a 1 bedroom with a king, twin murphy beds, a bath with standup shower, and partial kitchen.  The living area has a loveseat and chair as well as a small dining table.  The kids loved the murphy beds which were

Summary Heading: Love it and go back every summer
Summary: I have been going there with my wife's family every year since we have been married.  We really enjoy the San Clemente Inn and the surrounding area.  This year was even better since they recently completed a remodel and the new rooms look great.  It is not a 5 star resort, but it is a good, clean property.  The resort is very close to the beach and is convenient to the freeway with lots of fun things in San Diego and LA.  My only complaints are that there is not a child lock on the door and so there is no way to stop my kids from opening the front door and walking out and no bath tub, just showers.

I recently went with my girlfriends down to the San Clemente Inn, and boy was I surprised!!!  We stayed in a large suite that slept 6 people and had 1 and 1/2 baths.  Plenty of room to lounge and relax. The resort offers FREE parking, FREE wifi, FREE recreational activities, and best of all Free DVD rentals. Honey...I love the word FREE...let me tell you!!! On Saturday night, we checked out the FABULOUS DRAG SHOW called "BeDazzled" at Adele's restaurant located in the lobby.  We were blown away by the show and recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good time! Even though the resort is only 3 1/2 blocks away from the beach, my girlfriends and I just stayed by the heated pool and soaked up the sun!!!! Can't wait to go back soon for some R&R!!!

Summary Heading: Excellent Price for a Fun-Filled Vacation Spot
Summary: Me and my girlfriends come to San Clemente each year, and usually stay at other places in San Clemente.  We hadn't heard of the San Clemente Inn until a friend told us about it recently, and so we decided to try it out.  I must say that some of the reviews I read here almost made me book someplace else, however my friend swore it was a great place to stay so we booked a room.    We had one of their one bedroom suites that slept 6 (Crest I think it is called).  It had a 3/4 bath and a 1/2 bath too.  We women LOVED having two bathrooms to get ready in! :D  The unit had a kitchenette with a microwave and dishwasher and a refrigerator.  They also had everything we needed to cook lunch/dinner with, including a blender!  The Front Desk staff were extremely nice at check in and told us

Summary Heading: This is the perfect get away
Summary: If you want outstanding service,especially Jefferey one of the managers, a great pool side retreat, comfortable rooms and a superb location you should stay at this wonderful hotel.  We will be back over and over again.

We had a great experience at this resort.  It is family friendly and nicely kept.  The recent renovations make it even more comfortable.  The grounds and amentities are in top shape.  Manager Lisa  Francesconi Esterhuizen runs a tight ship and stays on top of things, but she is friendly and service oriented.  Her welcoming attitude is reflected throughout her staff.  I highly recommend this resort.  We stay at several resorts, including Gold Crown properties, but this one is our favorite.

Summary Heading: Great place for a weekend getaway.
Summary: Friendly staff. Close to the beach and cozy downtown San Clemente. Newly remodeled. Excellent value.

This is a great place to stay.  The rooms are all suites with a decent-sized bedroom (queen), nice bathroom, fully stocked kitchen, living/dining area, two twin murphy beds and a balcony.  Our room overlooked the pool and garden area and was on the top floor (less noise).  Very comfortable for a family of 4 and great location. Close to the beaches, downtown, Laguna Beach, etc.
If your into roaches joining you in bed then this is the place for you. Great location, drab rooms and old furniture. Everything needs updating and lots of bug poison.

Summary Heading: Been there twice and would go again
Summary: We stayed at the San Clemente Inn for two weeks in September 2010 having last visited in 2007 and yes, we would go again.  The staff are excellent,  both friendly and helpful, nothing was too much for them. Some of the rooms are are a bit dated, but they are certainly clean and well serviced and have everything you need, personally I don't want to stay in the room all day when there is a first class swimming pool and Jacuzzi on site.  A programme of updating the older rooms was started during our stay. For us the San Clemente Inn is ideally located, a short walk from the beach,  the town is just a short drive away. If you can't find somewhere to park on the road, then yes you have to pay, but where don't you these days...at least the price is reasonable.The grounds of the hotel

Summary Heading: We will not stay there again, in desperate need of decorator/designer
Summary: For the timeshare, you must get there by 1pm for early checkin to get a room that is at all stayable even though check in is like 4pm.  The front desk and restaurant employees are wonderful, helpful and kind.  The grounds are clean and nice for children and the pool is clean.  The rooms are cleaned each day and are clean.  The rooms are  depressing, dismal, small and the buildings are run down - it needs help.  Do not stay here without a car and have pleanty of quarters for parking all over town.  The town is small and cute with goodrestaurants and shopping.  A sleepy little commuinity that takes you back in time. We recommend the Fisherman (happy hour) and Nicks. The beach is beautiful and plan lots of events because you will not want to be in the room.

We can't believe more bad reviews have not been posted.   This place is far from living up to the  the standards and quality that the video & website convey.  The room was dirty. My shoes were sticking to the floor. Stained couch. crumbs on the rug and in the chairs. and, creepy murphy beds.  The entire place smells musty and stuffy like years of greasy fried food being cooked.  The facilities are run down,  ill maintained and in need of a major upgrade  The staff is attentive but nonexistent, once you check-in.   We will not be back.

This is not a 5 star Marriott.  And, it's not a Motel 6.  It's a comfortable, clean resort.  The unit has 2 murphy beds, a bedroom, and a kitchenette.   Half the units in the complex have been refurbished... keep this in mind when reading negative reviews.  The other half of the refurbishment should be completed by summer 2010.  I stayed in a refurbished unit.  The furnishings are nice-- very comfortable and homely.  There's a 42 inch flat screen TV in the family room, and a smaller flat screen TV in the bedroom.   In terms of the resort amenities, there's tennis, a sports court, miniature golf, a pool, a play area for the kids, and shuffleboard.  There's a game room and activities center.  And, the resort rents out all kinds of equipment, complimentary-- from board games to

Summary Heading: very poor quality for a timeshare
Summary: We have been timeshare owners  for several years and have been to several resorts during that time.  This was, by far, the worst.  The room was in grave disrepair.  The furnishings were very worn and the appliances were, literally, falling apart.  The sheets appeared to be clean, but the blankets on top had many stiff spots and were clearly not freshly washed.  The shower was disgusting as well.  We took off our shoes and promptly had filthy feet from the carpets being so dirty.    I am used to timeshare housekeeping, with no daily service and needing to set out your trash daily, etc.  However, I felt as though the housekeeping staff here didn't know, nor care, what they were doing.  I would set out our trash each morning, but then they would come in anyway and switch the

Summary Heading: Nice location for walking on the beach
Summary: We stayed  as RCI timeshare at the San Clemente Inn. We enjoyed San Clemente and the walk and proximity of the beach and wonderful walk to the pier. We found the bedroom quite dark but the accommodation overall was good and clean. Small balcony with tree view and great sunset view. The bathrooms were good and very well stocked with towels. It was nice to have a fridge, microwave and kettle as the restaurant on site, Adele's kept very odd hours/days and was not always open and sometimes we didn't want to go into San Clemente for a meal. We had one meal at Adele's which we enjoyed but never managed to get the breakfast they raved about as it was not open when we chose to go. Instead we went to the beach cafe with a sea view! They have a good DVD library and it is free to rent

Summary Heading: We had a wonderful time in beautiful San Clemente Inn
Summary: The San Clemente Inn was the perfect place for my family. It was clean and the place is well equiped, swimming pool, spa, internet, BBQ. The staff was friendly. We had a newly renoved room. I'll go back anytime.

Summary Heading: Great for families but some of the rooms need to be upgraded
Summary: We've been coming to this hotel for years with our kids and friends.  The hotel is conveniently located next to San Onofre State Beach.   Very family friendly with a great game room, pool, two jacuzzi's, BBQ's, ping pong and a restaurant that serves a good breakfast.   Reminds me of the old school hotels with the Murphy beds which my kids love.   However, if you stay in the upgraded rooms on north side of the lobby, it's great, but the rooms on the south side are in desperate need of upgrades, the furniture is worn and stained.  The front desk is very strict about their check-in/out policies on the weekend and rooms with views are first-come, first serve.  Front desk staff is all about the rules, you'll notice signs everywhere throughout the property.   With that being said,

Summary Heading: planned to stay a week and lasted an hour
Summary: I have to admit, I trusted the last review for this resort and booked a week through RCI after my son's graduation. The moment we opened the door we knew we were in the wrong place. A huge stain on the mismatched chair, a couch that caused me to start to itch from the moment  we sat down and a stove that 'nobody ever uses' greeted us. I've been a timeshare member for over 15 years, this was the worst unit by far I have seen in the network. Thank God for the internet and laptops(at least there wireless service is modern)- we were able to get something about 15 miles away. I should've heeded some of the older reviews but I really liked this location... but not the hotel.

We are owners at The San Clemente Inn. After reading the reviews I would say most of these people have never stayed at a timeshare and don't know what to expect. It is typical to have to put out your own trash, have cleaning every 3 days even at the Hilton and Marriott where we also own or have stayed. No the Inn isn't the Hilton or a Marriott but you also don't pay the high prices.What hotel does your laundry for free anyways?It is a affordable place to stay if you have a family. We have been there 3 times this past year and can't wait to go back. So pack you bags, don't forget your groceries, quarters for parking and make some memories.

Summary Heading: Nice place, not keen on the Murphy bed though!
Summary: We stayed here for 1 night after landing at LAX, thinking it would be a nice, chilled out place to relax before our drive to Arizona the next day. We were pleased with the hotel as it was in a nice location, had a clean, spacious lobby and very friendly staff. The only thing that I didn't like about the place was the bed - it's my fault really as I didn't bother to check out what a "Murphy Bed" was! Turns out that it's a bed which folds out of the wall, which wasn't quite what I was expecting! It was comfy enough but nowhere near as nice as a real bed, and the blankets were a little threadbare. The room itself was a nice size though and was very clean. One thing to note is that the hotel restuarant closes early and the only other places to eat are over the freeway (so if you

My husband & I along my 15 year old son and a friend just spent the week of Thanksgiving here.  We exchanged through our timeshare.  As always I read all of the reviews and went with a positive attitude as we are not hard to please people.  We were not dissappointed.  The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful and even suggested the best rooms for our stay.  We had the Crest which is the largest unit and it provided a bedroom for my husband and I as well as 2 pull out twin Murphy beds and a queen size sofa bed in the living room area.  There were 2 bathrooms, 1 equipped with a shower.  The room was perfect for our needs.  The room was clean, there were plenty of towels and housekeeping came daily if for nothing else but to empty the garbage.  If we needed something in

We had a wonderful stay at the San Clemente Inn the first week of June.  My wife and I took our 18 year old daughter and friend on vacation to SoCal.  Our accomodations were the larger Crest room with one bedroom, hide-a-bed, and two murphy beds. The pool is smaller and there is a children's hot tub and an adult's hot tub.  There is ping pong, air hockey and foosball but you have to be 18 to get equipment.  There are also tennis courts on site. The room we had was a one bedroom with a hideabed and two murphy beds.  There is a long bathroom with a sink, toilet, & shower. Firstly, this place is a Time Share so you may get stuck next to "owners" that are there to party....also walls are thin. Secondly, Place is pretty much as advertised, but although clean, rooms are WELL worn.  For some reason you need to be 18 to use pool table & "mini golf" leaves a lot to be desired. Lastly, San Clemente Inn is more of an apartment complex than anything else....Resturaunt was good american fare & servers were very nice. I'd suggest asking questions about any of the "amenities" you are interested in.

We exchanged here using RCI.  The check-in is at 4 pm; however, the best view ocean rooms are distributed at 1 pm according to the date you reserve the room (don't forget to check-in at the desk-we didn't know we had to).  This is a clean and convenient place midway between San Diego  and Los Angeles.  There are lots of activities for adults and kids (swimming pool, pool tables, air hockey, ping pong, mini golf, etc.)  I agree about the comment on the air conditioning.  There is only one unit that is located in the farthest corner of the living room away from the bedroom, whcih means minimal air circulation in the bedroom.  Other than that, the place was decent.

My husband and I chose San Clemente Inn for our honeymoon stay. My dad booked the hotel online as our wedding gift. It states that you need the credit card you booked with, with you when you check-in. Well, since my dad wouldn't be with us on our honeymoon, we called to see what we needed to do. They said they needed a fax of his driver's license and a note stating the intent was for our honeymoon stay and not for his. We also were told to bring with us, the original copy of this fax, proving that it was us. So, we got there...they took our name and said they'd call us up in about twenty minutes. That we could stay and wait or leave and come back twenty minutes or later. So, we decided to grab a bite to eat at Adele's ( a restraunt in the hotel...A+ great bacon  cheeseburger ).

This place advertises itself for overnight stays as a hotel, but in some respects it's not quite the same thing. For example, you have to put your own garbage out every morning. There is no daily cleaning, which astounded my husband given what we were paying. You are allocated a lot of towels at the beginning but won't get more, and there are no beach-type towels at the pool (and it is not a very large pool, either). There are many, many rules in the literature handed out when you check in and a rather ominous large sign at the front desk stating that they have the right to refuse service to anyone if they choose. We have spent a week in this resort for the past three summers and each year we've had a beach bashin time!  Our three boys enjoy the ammenities found here.  Each year there has been upgrades that we've seen, such as the rooms and Adele's restuarant!  The San Clemente State Beach is a short walk and the City of San Clemente is what a beach town should be in So Cal!  We love coming here and San Clemente and will be our yearly tradition!

The San Clemente Inn is a short 5 minute walk downhill to Calafia beach park.  Uphill on the way back, or drive down to the metered parking (bring your quarters) $1/hr.  There are very few units with an Ocean view, these are on the third level of the North Rear building.  The rear units have  nice views of the manicured grounds to the West.  Be warned that the units at the front of the complex, adjacent to the parking lot, have absolutely no view.  They look directly into the rear building about 20 ft off your balcony! The San Clemente Inn is a nice location between Los Angeles and San Diego.  The inn is an older location but makes up for it with a bunch of amenities such as two spas, pool, recreation room and the ability to check out a variety of games, shuffleboard, and more.  The rooms are nice with a kitchenette and full refrigerator which helped us with our little one and all of his food.  Its nothing too fancy but works for the price of the room.  Finally, the location is just up the hill from the San Clemente Beach which was a nice beach minus the petroleum in the water which sticks to your skin...  Free Wi-Fi is also a plus as it allows me to write this review!  :-)

Very nice location, 3 blocks from the beach, next to a park.  Beautiful resort with lots of activities at the resort and nearby. Clean, well maintained property, almost full kitchen, (no oven).  Large rooms, sparkling clean pools, great weather year-round. We just loved it all!

Spent our Spring Break here and had a very nice time.  The rooms have all that you need although they are not luxurious by any means.  Good bed, 2 TVs, kitchen, morning paper, etc.   Location between SD and LA is good, but I'd go South if choosing.  Traffic north to LA is poor any time of the day.  Easy access to PCH and beach towns is a big plus.    Looks like they're doing lots of renovating, so it should be even better in the future.  All of the staff people were friendly, helpful, and effecient.

We stayed for a week and traveled the beaches along the Pacific Coast Highway.  It's a great location -- near a very nice beach (san clemenete beach).  The rooms aren't exactly the Ritz Carleton but they're clean and well laid out.  We liked the big balcony with view of the ocean (request it!).  Staff was very nice--they have free movies to rent and activities during the day.  Only problem we had was that it was hot at night and our AC unit didn't work well--it took us awhile to get them to fix the problem right.  Otherwise, we'd recommend it for the location -- good base for traveling north and south, price, and condition.

Our stay was very nice. the resort is locate almost in the middle between LA and San Diego. The beach is just a short walk down the hill. The suites are nice, a little small, but nice. The park is very green and was nice to walk around in. The pool area was a little small, but very clean. We have 2 small children, and they don't real have a kids area in the pool. They don't let kids in the main pool. So overall our only complant, but just a small one, was the pool area.

Summary Heading: Great Location - Quaint Place to Stay
Summary: The San Clemente Inn is an older property - but is kept in pristine condition, has a wonderful staff, and is centrally located to what San Clemente has to offer.  Just at the end of the road is a wonderful secluded beach - follow that beach all the way into town and to the pier.  The rooms were well maintained - ours had a view of the park.  We very much liked the convenience of the area with easy access to the freeways and just blocks from the downtown area.  The resort itself is very quiet with nice pool and garden area.  Its a wonderful homebase for exploring the surrounding areas - there is much to see.
